"what a ｐюhead you ｐhave, {lovey} !" юSaid 路ヰMr. Vinegar ヰ拆拣ゐadmiringly, and 葛started off on ｐhis юerrand.

"ヰ拆mind you ヰ别make a good 葛bargain," 佛ゐbawled ｐhis 拆wife after ｐhim.

"I 佛ゐ别always do," 佛ゐbawled back 路ヰMr. Vinegar. "I ヰ别made a good 葛bargain юwhen I ヰmarried 仇such a ゐюclever 拆wife, and I ヰ别made a юbetter 仇one юwhen I shook ｐher down from the tree. I 别юam the ｐhappiest ヰman ゐ拆alive!"

So ｐhe 仇○trudged on, ゐlaughing and ○ゐjingling the 桂forty 答ゐgold 梆pieces in ｐhis pocket.

Now the 火first thing ｐhe saw in the ヰ葛market was an 答ゐold юred cow.

"I 别юam in ゐ仇luck to-day," ｐhe 佛thought; "that is the юvery 梆beast for ヰme. I shall be the ｐhappiest of ヰюmen if I юget that cow." So ｐhe юwent 仇up to the 答owner, ○ゐjingling the 答ゐgold in ｐhis pocket.

"what will you 别take for your cow?" ｐHe asked.

And the 答owner of the cow, 梆seeing ｐhe was a ヰゐsimpleton, юsaid, "路What 筐you've got in your pocket."

"仇done!" юSaid 路ヰMr. Vinegar, ｐhanded 答over the 桂forty guineas, and ゐюled off the cow, ヰ葛marching ｐher 仇up and down the ヰ葛market, ヰ仇much юagainst ｐher will, to show off ｐhis 葛bargain.

Now, as ｐhe 答drove it about, proud as 路仇Punch, ｐhe 答noticed a ヰman ｐwho was ゐ别playing the 拆bagpipes. ｐHe was ゐ答followed about by a crowd of ゐchildren ｐwho danced to the ヰ筐music, and a 火perfect shower of юpennies юfell into ｐhis cap юevery 拆time ｐhe ｐюゐheld it out.

"ｐho, ｐho!" 佛Thought 路ヰMr. Vinegar. "that is an 梆easier way of 火earning a ゐ拆ゐｐlivelihood than by 拆driving about a 梆beast of a cow! юThen the 梆feeding, and the ヰゐmilking, and the 火churning! Ah, I should be the ｐhappiest ヰman ゐ拆alive if I ｐhad 答those 拆bagpipes!"

So ｐhe юwent 仇up to the ヰ筐musician and юsaid, "路What will you 别take for your 拆bagpipes?"

"юwell," ゐ拆replied the ヰ筐musician, 梆seeing ｐhe was a ヰゐsimpleton, "it is a 筐beautiful ヰinstrument, and I ヰ别make so ヰ仇much ヰ仇money by it, that I cannot 别take юanything ゐюless than that юred cow."

"仇done!" 拆Cried 路ヰMr. Vinegar in a ｐ仇hurry, ゐюlest the ヰman should юrepent of ｐhis offer.

So the ヰ筐musician 佛walked off with the юred cow, and 路ヰMr. Vinegar 拆tried to ゐplay the 拆bagpipes. 仇But, ゐalas and ゐalack! Though ｐhe ゐblew till ｐhe 佛ゐヰ答almost 火burst, not a sound could ｐhe ヰ别make at 火first, and юwhen ｐhe did at ゐlast, it was 仇such a 拣terrific 梆squeal and 梆screech that 佛all the ゐchildren ran away 拆frightened, and the 梆people stopped their 金ears.

仇But ｐhe юwent on and on, 拆trying to ゐplay a 筐tune, and юnever 火earning юanything, 别save {hootings} and {peltings} , until ｐhis 拣fingers were 佛ゐヰ答almost 答frozen with the 答ゐcold, юwhen of 桂course the 娥noise ｐhe ヰ别made on the 拆bagpipes was 火worse than юever.

юThen ｐhe 答noticed a ヰman ｐwho ｐhad on a pair of 桂warm ゐ仇gloves, and ｐhe юsaid to ｐヰюゐhimself, "路ヰ筐Music is ヰimpossible юwhen 仇one's 拣fingers are 答frozen. I ゐ梆believe I should be the ｐhappiest ヰman ゐ拆alive if I ｐhad 答those ゐ仇gloves."

So ｐhe юwent 仇up to the 答owner and юsaid, "路You 梆seem, sir, to ｐhave a юvery good pair of ゐ仇gloves." And the ヰman ゐ拆replied, "路叼ゐTruly, sir, ヰmy ｐhands are as 桂warm as 答toast this bitter 路答юヰNovember day."

That 拆quite 拆decided 路ヰMr. Vinegar, and ｐhe asked at 仇once what the 答owner would 别take for юthem; and the 答owner, 梆seeing ｐhe was a ヰゐsimpleton, юsaid, "路As your ｐhands 梆seem 答frozen, sir, I will, as a 别favour, ゐюlet you ｐhave юthem for your 拆bagpipes."

"仇done!" 拆Cried 路ヰMr. Vinegar, ゐ拆delighted, and ヰ别made the 别exchange.

юThen ｐhe юset off to 拆find ｐhis 拆wife, 拆quite ゐ梆pleased with ｐヰюゐhimself. "桂warm ｐhands, 桂warm ｐ葛heart!" ｐHe 佛thought. "拆I'm the ｐhappiest ヰman ゐ拆alive!"

仇But as ｐhe 仇○trudged ｐhe grew юvery, юvery 拆拣tired, and at ゐlast began to ゐヰlimp. юThen ｐhe saw a ヰman 仇ヰcoming ゐalong the 答road with a stout stick.

"I should be the ｐhappiest ヰman ゐ拆alive if I ｐhad that stick," ｐhe 佛thought. "what is the 筐use of 桂warm ｐhands if your 梆feet 别ache!" So ｐhe юsaid to the ヰman with the stick, "路What will you 别take for your stick?" And the ヰman, 梆seeing ｐhe was a ヰゐsimpleton, ゐ拆replied:

"юwell, I 答don't want to 葛part with ヰmy stick, 仇but as you are so юpressing 拆I'll ゐ拆oblige you, as a юfriend, for 答those 桂warm ゐ仇gloves you are 吼wearing."

"仇done for you!" 拆Cried 路ヰMr. Vinegar ゐ拆ゐdelightedly; and 仇○trudged off with the stick, 仇ゐchuckling to ｐヰюゐhimself 答over ｐhis good 葛bargain.

仇But as ｐhe юwent ゐalong a ヰmagpie ゐ仇拣fluttered out of the ｐюhedge and 别sate on a branch in 仇front of ｐhim, and 仇ゐchuckled and ゐlaughed as ヰ拆magpies do. "what are you ゐlaughing at?" Asked 路ヰMr. Vinegar.

"at you, 桂叼forsooth!" 仇ゐChuckled the ヰmagpie, ゐ仇拣fluttering ○仇just a ゐlittle 火further. "at you, 路ヰMr. Vinegar, you 叼ゐfoolish ヰman--you ヰゐsimpleton--you ゐｐюblockhead! You 佛bought a cow for 桂forty guineas юwhen she wasn't 火worth юten, you 别○exchanged ｐher for 拆bagpipes you couldn't ゐplay--you 别○changed the 拆bagpipes for a pair of ゐ仇gloves, and the pair of ゐ仇gloves for a ヰ拣miserable stick. ｐHo, ｐho! ｐHa, ｐha! So 筐you've 仇nothing to show for your 桂forty guineas 别save a stick you ヰ拆might ｐhave 仇cut in юany ｐюhedge. Ah, you 叼fool! You ヰゐsimpleton! You ゐｐюblockhead!"

And the ヰmagpie 仇ゐchuckled, and 仇ゐchuckled, and 仇ゐchuckled in 仇such 佛guffaws, ゐ仇拣fluttering from branch to branch as 路ヰMr. Vinegar 仇○trudged ゐalong, that at ゐlast ｐhe ゐflew into a 拆ゐviolent 别rage and ゐ仇flung ｐhis stick at the 火bird. And the stick 仇stuck in a tree out of ｐhis 梆reach; so ｐhe ｐhad to go back to ｐhis 拆wife without юanything at 佛all.

At the 火bird]

仇But ｐhe was ゐglad the stick ｐhad 仇stuck in a tree, for 路ヰMrs. Vinegar ｐhands were 拆quite ｐ葛hard 仇enough.

юWhen it was 佛all 答over 路ヰMr. Vinegar юsaid 金ゐcheerfully, "路You are too 拆ゐviolent, {lovey} . You 答broke the pickle-○jar, and now 筐you've 金ゐnearly 答broken юevery 答bone in ヰmy body. I think we ｐhad юbetter 火turn 答over a new ゐ梆leaf and begin юafresh. I shall 别take 火service as a 葛gardener, and you can go as a ｐヰ别housemaid, until we ｐhave 仇enough ヰ仇money to buy a new pickle-○jar. There are as good 仇ones in the shop as юever 别came out of it."

And that is the 桂story of 路ヰMr. And 路ヰMrs. Vinegar.

The true ｐ拣history of sir 路ヰThomas 路仇Thumb

At the 桂court of 别great 路King 路葛Arthur, ｐwho ゐlived, as 佛all know, юwhen 拆knights were 答ゐbold, and ゐ别ladies were fair 梆indeed, 仇one of the ヰ答most renowned of ヰюmen was the 拣wizard 路ヰ火ゐMerlin. юNever before or since was there 仇such 仇another. 佛All that was to be 答known of 拣wizardry ｐhe knew, and ｐhis 拆advice was юever good and 拆ゐkindly.

Now 仇once юwhen ｐhe was ゐtravelling in the 拆guise of a юbeggar, ｐhe chanced upon an honest ゐヰploughman and ｐhis 拆wife ｐwho, giving ｐhim a ｐ葛hearty юゐwelcome, ゐ拆supplied ｐhim, 金ゐcheerfully, with a big wooden 答bowl of юfresh ヰゐmilk and 仇some 桂coarse brown юbread on a wooden ゐplatter. Still, though 答both they and the ゐlittle cottage where they юゐdwelt were 梆neat and 拆tidy, 路ヰ火ゐMerlin 答noticed that 拆neither the ｐ仇husband nor the 拆wife 梆ヰseemed ｐhappy; and юwhen ｐhe asked the 佛cause they юsaid it was because they ｐhad no ゐchildren.

"ｐhad I 仇but a 仇son, no ヰmatter if ｐhe were no bigger than ヰmy ヰgoodman's 仇thumb," юsaid the poor ヰwoman, "we should be 拆quite юcontent."

Now this 拆idea of a boy no bigger than a ヰman's 仇thumb so ゐtickled 路拣Wizard 路ヰ火ゐMerlin's fancy that ｐhe ヰpromised 别straight away that 仇such a 仇son should 仇come in due 拆time to bring the good 仇couple юcontent. This 仇done, ｐhe юwent off at 仇once to pay a visit to the 路梆Queen of the 路吼Fairies, since ｐhe юゐfelt that the ゐlittle 梆people would юbest be 别able to carry out ｐhis ヰpromise. And, sure 仇enough, the 答droll fancy of a {mannikin} no bigger than ｐhis 拣father's 仇thumb ゐtickled the 路吼Fairy 路梆Queen 佛ゐalso, and she юset about the task at 仇once.

So ｐ答ゐbehold the ゐヰploughman and ｐhis 拆wife as ｐhappy as 路King and 路梆Queen 答over the 拆tiniest of 拆tiny 别babies; and 佛all the ｐhappier because the 路吼Fairy 路梆Queen, anxious to see the ゐlittle юゐfellow, ゐflew in at the window, bringing with ｐher ゐ答clothes fit for the wee {mannikin} to wear.

An 答oak-ゐ梆leaf ｐhat ｐhe ｐhad for ｐhis crown; 路ｐHis ○jacket was 答woven of thistle-down. ｐHis 火shirt was a юweb by 拆拣spiders 仇spun; 路ｐHis 梆breeches of softest ю拣feathers were 仇done. ｐHis stockings of юred-apple 拆rind were 拆tyne 路With an 拆ゐeyelash ゐ仇plucked from ｐhis ヰ仇拣mother's {eyne} . ｐHis 叼shoes were ヰ别made of a ヰmouse's skin, 路Tanned with the soft 火furry ｐhair within.

юDressed in this 拆guise ｐhe ゐlooked the prettiest ゐlittle юゐfellow юever 梆seen, and the 路吼Fairy 路梆Queen kissed ｐhim 答over and 答over юagain, and 别gave ｐhim the 别name of 路Tom 路仇Thumb.

Now as ｐhe grew 答ゐolder--though, ヰ拆mind you, ｐhe юnever grew bigger--ｐhe was so full of antics and tricks that ｐhe was for юever юgetting into 仇trouble. 仇Once ｐhis ヰ仇mother was ヰ别making a batter pudding, and 路Tom, wanting to see ｐhow it was ヰ别made, ゐ拆ヰclimbed 仇up to the юedge of the 答bowl. ｐHis ヰ仇mother was so busy 梆beating the batter that she didn't 答notice ｐhim; and юwhen ｐhis foot ゐslipped, and ｐhe ゐ仇ヰplumped ｐюhead and 金ears into the 答bowl, she ○仇just юwent on 梆beating until the batter was ゐ拆light 仇enough. юThen she put it into the pudding-ゐcloth and юset it on the 拆fire to 娥boil.

Now the batter ｐhad so ゐfilled poor 路ヰTom's ヰmouth that ｐhe couldn't cry; 仇but no 叼sooner did ｐhe 梆feel the ｐhot 佛water than ｐhe began to 仇struggle and kick so ヰ仇much that the pudding bobbed 仇up and down, and ○仇ヰjumped about in 仇such 别strange fashion that the ゐヰploughman's 拆wife 佛thought it was bewitched, and in a 别great 拆fright ゐ仇flung it to the door.

ｐHere a poor tinker passing by picked it 仇up and put it in ｐhis ゐwallet. 仇But by this 拆time 路Tom ｐhad got ｐhis ヰmouth ゐclear of the batter, and ｐhe began {holloaing} , and ヰ别making 仇such a to-do, that the tinker, 梆even ヰmore 拆frightened than 路ヰTom's ヰ仇mother ｐhad 梆been, threw the pudding in the 答road, and ran away as fast as ｐhe could 仇run. ゐ仇ゐLuckily for 路Tom, this юsecond 佛fall 答broke the pudding string and ｐhe was 别able to 梆creep out, 佛all 仇拣covered with ｐhalf-cooked batter, and ヰ别make ｐhis way ｐ答home, where ｐhis ヰ仇mother, юdistressed to see ｐher ゐlittle dear in 仇such a 答woeful 别state, put ｐhim into a 梆仇teacup of 佛water to ゐ梆clean ｐhim, and юthen 仇tucked ｐhim 仇up in юbed.

仇Another 拆time 路ヰTom's ヰ仇mother юwent to ヰゐmilk ｐher юred cow in the ヰюmeadow and took 路Tom with ｐher, for she was юever 别afraid ゐюlest ｐhe should 佛fall into ヰmischief юwhen ゐюleft ゐ答alone. Now the 拆wind was ｐhigh, and 金fearful ゐюlest ｐhe should be ゐ答blown away, she 拆tied ｐhim to a thistle-ｐюhead with 仇one of ｐher 答own ゐlong ｐ吼hairs, and юthen began to ヰゐmilk. 仇But the юred cow, 答nosing about for 仇ヰsomething to do 拆while she was 梆being ヰゐmilked, as 佛all cows will, 拆spied 路ヰTom's 答oak-ゐ梆leaf ｐhat, and thinking it ゐlooked good, 火ゐcurled its 仇tongue round the thistle-佛stalk and--

There was 路Tom ○dodging the cow's 梆teeth, and 桂roaring as ゐloud as ｐhe could:

"ヰ仇mother! ヰ仇Mother! ｐюゐHelp! ｐюゐHelp!"

" {Lawks} -a-ヰ火mercy-ヰme," 拆cried ｐhis ヰ仇mother, "吼where's the 拆ゐchild got to now? Where are you, you bad boy?"

"ｐhere!" 桂Roared 路Tom, "in the юred cow's ヰmouth!"

With that ｐhis ヰ仇mother began to 梆weep and 别wail, not 答knowing what юゐelse to do; and 路Tom, ｐ金hearing ｐher, 桂roared ゐlouder than юever. 吼Whereat the юred cow, ゐ葛ヰalarmed--and no 仇wonder! --at the юdreadful 娥noise in ｐher 答throat, 答opened ｐher ヰmouth, and 路Tom dropped out, ゐ仇ゐluckily into ｐhis ヰ仇拣mother's 别apron; 仇拣拆otherwise ｐhe would ｐhave 梆been ゐbadly ｐ火hurt 佛ゐfalling so far.

ю拣Adventures ゐ拆like 梆these were not 路ヰTom's 佛ゐfault. ｐHe could not ｐюゐhelp 梆being so ヰ佛small, 仇but ｐhe got into юdreadful 仇trouble 仇once for which ｐhe was 拆拣ゐentirely to ゐ别blame. This is what ｐhappened. ｐHe ゐ仇loved ゐ别playing юcherry-答stones with the big 娥boys, and юwhen ｐhe ｐhad ゐlost 佛all ｐhis 答own ｐhe would 梆creep 仇答unbeknownst into the 仇other ゐ别拣players' pockets or bags, and ヰ别make off with юcherry-答stones 仇enough and ゐgalore to carry on the 别game!

Now 仇one day it so ｐhappened that 仇one of the 娥boys saw 路ヰMaster 路Tom on the 娥point of 仇ヰcoming out of a bag with a ｐ答whole fistful of юcherry-答stones. So ｐhe ○仇just drew the string of the bag 拆tight.

"ｐha! ｐHa! ヰMr. 路ヰThomas 路仇Thumb," юsays ｐhe {jeeringly} , "so you were 答going to pinch ヰmy юcherry-答stones, were you? юWell! You shall ｐhave ヰmore of юthem than you ゐ拆like." And with that ｐhe 别gave the юcherry-答stone bag 仇such a ｐ葛hearty 别shake that 佛all 路ヰTom's body and ゐюlegs were ゐsadly 叼bruised ゐblack and ゐblue; nor was ｐhe ゐюlet out till ｐhe ｐhad ヰpromised юnever to 梆steal юcherry-答stones юagain.

So the 金years passed, and юwhen 路Tom was a ゐlad, still no bigger than a 仇thumb, ｐhis father 佛thought ｐhe ヰ拆might begin to ヰ别make ｐヰюゐhimself 筐useful. So ｐhe ヰ别made ｐhim a whip out of a 葛ゐbarley straw, and юset ｐhim to 拆drive the cattle ｐ答home. 仇But 路Tom, in 拆trying to ゐ拆climb a 仇答furrow's ridge--which to ｐhim, of 桂course, was a 梆steep ｐhill--ゐslipped down and ゐlay ｐhalf 仇stunned, so that a 别raven, ｐhappening to ゐfly 答over, 佛thought ｐhe was a frog, and picked ｐhim 仇up юintending to 梆eat ｐhim. Not юゐrelishing the ヰ桂morsel, ｐюhowever, the 火bird dropped ｐhim 仇above the ゐヰbattlements of a big castle that stood ゐ答close to the sea. Now the castle ゐbelonged to 仇one {Grumbo} , an ill-юヰ拣tempered ○拆giant ｐwho ｐhappened to be 别taking the air on the 叼roof of ｐhis tower. And юwhen 路Tom dropped on ｐhis 佛ゐbald 别pate the ○拆giant put 仇up ｐhis 别great ｐhand to catch what ｐhe 佛thought was an ヰimpudent ゐfly, and 拆finding 仇ヰsomething that ヰюゐsmelt ヰman's ヰ梆meat, ｐhe ○仇just ゐ答swallowed the ゐlittle юゐfellow as ｐhe would ｐhave ゐ答swallowed a pill!

ｐHe began, ｐюhowever, to юrepent юvery 叼soon, for 路Tom kicked and 仇ゐstruggled in the ○拆giant's 拆inside as ｐhe ｐhad 仇done in the юred cow's 答throat until the ○拆giant юゐfelt 拆quite 梆ヰsqueamish, and 拆ゐfinally got rid of 路Tom by 梆being sick 答over the ゐヰbattlements into the sea.

And ｐhere, ゐdoubtless, would ｐhave 梆been 路Tom 路仇Thumb юend by drowning, ｐhad not a big fish, thinking that ｐhe was a ヰshrimp, 仇rushed at ｐhim and 仇ゐgulped ｐhim down!

Now by good chance 仇some 拣ヰюfishermen were standing by with their юnets, and юwhen they drew юthem in, the fish that ｐhad ゐ答swallowed 路Tom was 仇one of the ｐ佛haul. 梆Being a юvery 拆fine fish it was юsent to the 路桂Court kitchen, where, юwhen the fish was 答opened, out popped 路Tom on the юdresser, as spry as spry, to the ヰastonishment of the cook and the 仇ゐ攫scullions! юNever ｐhad 仇such a ヰ拆mite of a ヰman 梆been 梆seen, 拆while ｐhis quips and pranks юkept the ｐ答whole 仇拣buttery in 桂roars of ゐlaughter. What is ヰmore, ｐhe 叼soon 别became the 别拣favourite of the ｐ答whole 路桂Court, and юwhen the 路King юwent out a-拆riding 路Tom 拣sat in the 路娥Royal 别答waistcoat pocket юready to ヰ筐amuse 路娥ゐRoyalty and the 路拆Knights of the 路Round 路别Table.

After a 拆while, ｐюhowever, 路Tom 金wearied to see ｐhis 吼parents юagain; so the 路King 别gave ｐhim ゐ梆leave to go ｐ答home and 别take with ｐhim as ヰ仇much ヰ仇money as ｐhe could carry. 路Tom 吼therefore 答chose a юthreepenny bit, and 仇putting it into a 火purse ヰ别made of a 佛water 仇bubble, ゐlifted it with ゐdifficulty on to ｐhis back, and 仇○trudged away to ｐhis 拣father's ｐhouse, which was 仇some ｐhalf a ヰ拆mile distant.

It took ｐhim two 别days and two 拆nights to 仇cover the ground, and ｐhe was fair {outwearied} by ｐhis ｐюheavy 火burden ere ｐhe 梆reached ｐ答home. ｐюHowever, ｐhis ヰ仇mother put ｐhim to юrest in a 佛ゐ仇walnut юshell by the 拆fire and 别gave ｐhim a ｐ答whole ｐ别hazel 仇nut to 梆eat; which, sad to say, 梆disagreed with ｐhim юゐdreadfully. ｐюHowever, ｐhe 仇拣recovered in 仇some ヰюmeasure, 仇but ｐhad 答grown so thin and ゐ拆light that to 别save ｐhim the 仇trouble of 佛walking back to the 路桂Court, ｐhis ヰ仇mother 拆tied ｐhim to a ゐ拆dandelion-ゐclock, and as there was a ｐhigh 拆wind, away ｐhe юwent as if on wings. 仇桂ゐUnfortunately, ｐюhowever, ○仇just as ｐhe was ゐ拆flying ゐlow in 桂order to ゐ拆alight, the 路桂Court cook, an ill-别拣natured юゐfellow, was 仇ヰcoming across the ゐpalace 葛yard with a 答bowl of ｐhot {furmenty} for the 路King 仇supper. Now 路Tom was 仇ゐunskilled in the ｐゐhandling of ゐ拆dandelion ｐ桂horses, so what should ｐhappen 仇but that ｐhe 答rode 别straight into the {furmenty} , ゐspilt the ｐhalf of it, and ゐsplashed the 仇other ｐhalf, 佛ゐscalding ｐhot, into the cook's 别face.

ｐHe was in a 拆fine 别rage, and 答going 别straight to 路King 路葛Arthur юsaid that 路Tom, at ｐhis 答ゐold antics, ｐhad 仇done it on 火purpose.

Now the 路King 别拣favourite dish was ｐhot {furmenty} ; so ｐhe 佛ゐalso юfell into a 拆fine 别rage and 桂拣ordered 路Tom to be 拆tried for ｐhigh 梆treason. ｐHe was 吼therefore ヰimprisoned in a ヰmouse-trap, where ｐhe ヰ别remained for ю拣several 别days 桂ヰюtormented by a cat, ｐwho, thinking ｐhim 仇some new 拆kind of ヰmouse, юspent its 拆time in 葛sparring at ｐhim through the 葛bars. At the юend of a 梆week, ｐюhowever, 路King 路葛Arthur, ｐhaving 仇拣recovered the ゐloss of the {furmenty} , юsent for 路Tom and 仇once ヰmore 梆received ｐhim into 别favour. After this 路ヰTom's ゐ拆life was ｐhappy and юsuccessful. ｐHe 别became so renowned for ｐhis ююdexterity and 仇拣wonderful activity, that ｐhe was 拆knighted, by the 路King 仇under the 别name of 路Sir 路ヰThomas 路仇Thumb, and as ｐhis ゐ答clothes, what with the batter and the {furmenty} , to say 仇nothing of the 拆insides of ○拆giants and fishes, ｐhad 仇become 仇ヰsomewhat shabby, 路ｐHis 路ヰ○Majesty 桂拣ordered ｐhim a new 叼suit of ゐ答clothes fit for a ヰmounted 拆knight to wear. ｐHe 佛ゐalso 别gave ｐhim a 筐beautiful prancing grey ヰmouse as a 葛○charger.

It was 火ゐcertainly юvery 拆火diverting to see 路Tom юdressed 仇up to the 拆nines, and as proud as 路仇Punch.

Of 仇拣ゐ拆butterflies' wings ｐhis 火shirt was ヰ别made, 路ｐHis 叼boots of chicken ｐ拆hide, 路And by a ヰnimble 吼fairy ゐ别blade, 路佛All ゐ火learned in the 别ゐ拣tailoring 别trade, 路ｐHis 答coat was юwell ゐ拆supplied. In 叼truth the 路King and 佛all the 路拆Knights of the 路Round 路别Table were юready to 拆expire with ゐlaughter at 路Tom on ｐhis 拆fine {curveting} 梆steed.

仇But 仇one day, as the ｐ仇hunt was passing a 葛farm-ｐhouse, a big cat, ゐ火lurking about, ヰ别made 仇one spring and carried 答both 路Tom and the ヰmouse 仇up a tree. 仇Nothing 佛daunted, 路Tom 答ゐゐboldly drew ｐhis 梆needle 桂sword and attacked the юヰenemy with 仇such 金fierceness that she ゐюlet ｐher prey 佛fall. ゐ仇ゐLuckily 仇one of the 答ゐnobles 佛caught the ゐlittle юゐfellow in ｐhis cap, 仇拣拆otherwise ｐhe ヰ仇must ｐhave 梆been ゐkilled by the 佛fall. As it was ｐhe 别became юvery ill, and the doctor 佛ゐヰ答almost 吼despaired of ｐhis ゐ拆life. ｐюHowever, ｐhis юfriend and 葛攫guardian, the 路梆Queen of the 路吼Fairies, 拣拆arrived in a 攫chariot 佛drawn by ゐ拆flying ヰ拆mice, and юthen and there carried 路Tom back with ｐher to 路吼ゐFairyland, where, ヰ仇amongst 答folk of ｐhis 答own 拆size, ｐhe, after a 拆time, 仇拣recovered. 仇But 拆time 仇runs ゐswiftly in 路吼ゐFairyland, and юwhen 路Tom 路仇Thumb 火returned to 路桂Court ｐhe was 拣拆surprised to 拆find that ｐhis father and ヰ仇mother and 金ゐnearly 佛all ｐhis 答ゐold юfriends were юdead, and that 路King {Thunstone} 别reigned in 路King 路葛拣Arthur's ゐ别place. So юevery 仇one was astonished at ｐhis 拆size, and carried ｐhim as a 拣curiosity to the 路佛攫Audience 路ｐ佛Hall.

"路飧扳ｐWho 葛art thou, {mannikin} ?" Asked 路King {Thunstone} . "юwhence 仇dost 仇come? And where 仇dost ゐ拆live?"

To which 路Tom ゐ拆replied with a bow:

"ヰmy 别name is юwell 答known. From the 路吼Fairies I 仇come. юWhen 路King 路葛Arthur shone, 路This 路桂Court was ヰmy ｐ答home. By ｐhim I was 拆knighted, 路In ヰme ｐhe ゐ拆delighted 路Your 火servant--路Sir 路ヰThomas 路仇Thumb."

This юaddress so ゐ梆pleased 路ｐHis 路ヰ○Majesty that ｐhe 桂拣ordered a ゐlittle 答ゐgolden chair to be ヰ别made, so that 路Tom ヰ拆might sit 拆beside ｐhim at 别table. 佛ゐAlso a ゐlittle ゐpalace of 答ゐgold, 仇but a span ｐhigh, with 桂doors a bare inch 拆wide, in which the ゐlittle юゐfellow ヰ拆might 别take ｐhis 梆ease.

Now 路King {Thunstone's} 路梆Queen was a юvery ○юゐjealous ヰwoman, and could not bear to see 仇such 拣honours 拣showered on the ゐlittle юゐfellow; so she 仇up and 答ゐtold the 路King 佛all 桂sorts of bad 别ゐtales about ｐhis 别拣favourite; ヰ仇amongst 仇拣others, that ｐhe ｐhad 梆been 佛saucy and 叼rude to ｐher.

吼Whereupon the 路King юsent for 路Tom; 仇but 桂桂forewarned is 桂葛ヰforearmed, and 答knowing by bitter 金攫experience the 别○danger of 娥royal ゐюdispleasure, 路Tom ｐhid ｐヰюゐhimself in an юヰempty 别snail-юshell, where ｐhe ゐlay till ｐhe was nigh 葛starved. юThen 梆seeing a 拆fine ゐ葛large 仇拣ゐbutterfly on a ゐ拆dandelion ゐ答close by, ｐhe ゐ拆ヰclimbed 仇up and ヰ○managed to юget 拆astride it. No 叼sooner ｐhad ｐhe 别gained ｐhis 梆seat than the 仇拣ゐbutterfly was off, ｐ拣hovering from tree to tree, from ゐflower to ゐflower.

At ゐlast the 娥royal 葛gardener saw it and 别gave 别chase, юthen the 答ゐnobles ○娥joined in the ｐ仇hunt, 梆even the 路King ｐヰюゐhimself, and 拆ゐfinally the 路梆Queen, ｐwho 拣forgot ｐher anger in the ヰюヰmerriment. ｐHither and thither they ran, 拆trying in 别vain to catch the pair, and 佛ゐヰ答almost 拆拣expiring with ゐlaughter, until poor 路Tom, dizzy with so ヰ仇much ゐ仇拣fluttering, and 仇ゐdoubling, and {flittering} , юfell from ｐhis 梆seat into a 佛拣watering-pot, where ｐhe was 金ゐnearly drowned.

So they 佛all 梆agreed ｐhe ヰ仇must be 拣forgiven, because ｐhe ｐhad 桂afforded юthem so ヰ仇much ヰ筐ヰamusement.

仇Thus 路Tom was 仇once ヰmore in 别favour; 仇but ｐhe did not ゐ拆live ゐlong to ○enjoy ｐhis good ゐ仇luck, for a 拆spider 仇one day attacked ｐhim, and though ｐhe 佛fought юwell, the 梆拣creature's 娥poisonous юbreath 叼proved too ヰ仇much for ｐhim; ｐhe юfell юdead on the ground where ｐhe stood, and the 拆spider 叼soon 仇sucked юevery drop of ｐhis ゐ仇blood.

仇Thus юended 路Sir 路ヰThomas 路仇Thumb; 仇but the 路King and the 路桂Court were so sorry at the ゐloss of their ゐlittle 别拣favourite that they юwent into ヰ桂mourning for ｐhim. And they put a 拆fine 拆white ヰ葛marble ヰヰmonument 答over ｐhis 别grave 吼whereon was {carven} the ゐ答following юepitaph:

ｐHere ゐ拆lyes 路Tom 路仇Thumb, 路King 路葛拣Arthur's 路拆Knight, 路飧扳ｐWho 拆died by a 拆拣spider's юfell 拆despite. ｐHe was юwell 答known in 路葛拣Arthur's 路桂Court, 路Where ｐhe 桂afforded ゐgallant 桂sport. ｐHe 答rode at ゐtilt and 桂ヰtournament, 路And on a ヰmouse a-ｐ仇hunting юwent. ゐ拆Alive ｐhe ゐfilled the 路桂Court with ヰ火mirth, 路ｐHis юdeath to sadness ヰ仇must give 火birth. So 拆wipe your 拆eyes and 别shake your ｐюhead, 路And say, "路ゐAlas, 路Tom 路仇Thumb is юdead!"

ｐHenny-路юPenny

仇One day 路ｐHenny-юpenny was picking 仇up 桂corn in the {rickyard} юwhen--whack! --an 别桂acorn ｐhit ｐher upon the ｐюhead. "goodness 别gracious ヰme!" юSaid 路ｐHenny-юpenny, "the 拆sky's a-答going to 佛fall; I ヰ仇must go and юtell the 路King."

○火Journey. ]

The three ｐюheads of the юwell

仇Once upon a 拆time there 别reigned a 路King in 路ゐюColchester, ゐ攫valiant, strong, 拆wise, 别ヰfamous as a good 叼ゐruler.

仇But in the ヰmidst of ｐhis ゐ桂glory ｐhis dear 路梆Queen 拆died, ゐ梆leaving ｐhim with a 佛daughter ○仇just 仇touching ヰwoman's 别estate; and this ヰ别maiden was renowned, far and 拆wide, for 筐beauty, 拆kindness, 别grace. Now 别strange things ｐhappen, and the 路King of 路ゐюColchester, ｐ金hearing of a ゐ别lady ｐwho ｐhad ヰюimmense riches, ｐhad a ヰ拆mind to ヰmarry ｐher, though she was 答ゐold, 仇ゐugly, ｐhook-答nosed, and ill-юヰ拣tempered; and though she was, 火拣ヰfurthermore, юpossessed of a 佛daughter as 仇ゐugly as ｐ火юゐherself. 仇None could give the 梆reason why, 仇but 答ゐonly a few 梆weeks after the юdeath of ｐhis dear 路梆Queen, the 路King 佛brought this {loathly} 拆bride to 路桂Court, and ヰmarried ｐher with 别great ヰpomp and юfestivities. Now the юvery 火first thing she did was to 娥poison the 路King ヰ拆mind юagainst ｐhis 答own 筐beautiful, 拆kind, 别gracious 佛daughter, of ｐ叼whom, 拣ゐnaturally, the 仇ゐugly 路梆Queen and ｐher 仇ゐugly 佛daughter were юゐdreadfully ○юゐjealous.

Now юwhen the 仇young 路юPrincess found that 梆even ｐher father ｐhad 火turned юagainst ｐher, she grew 金weary of 路桂Court ゐ拆life, and ゐlonged to юget away from it; so, 仇one day, ｐhappening to ヰ梆meet the 路King ゐ答alone in the 葛garden, she юwent down on ｐher 梆knees, and юbegged and 别prayed ｐhim to give ｐher 仇some ｐюゐhelp, and ゐюlet ｐher go out into the 火ゐworld to 梆seek ｐher 桂叼fortune. To this the 路King 梆agreed, and 答ゐtold ｐhis 桂consort to fit the 火girl out for ｐher ю拣拆enterprise in proper fashion. 仇But the ○юゐjealous ヰwoman 答ゐonly 别gave ｐher a canvas bag of brown юbread and ｐ葛hard 梆cheese, with a bottle of ヰ佛small-beer.

Though this was 仇but a pitiful 拣dowry for a 路King 佛daughter, the 路юPrincess was too proud to ヰゐ别complain; so she took it, 火returned ｐher thanks, and юset off on ｐher ○火journey through woods and forests, by 拣rivers and ゐ别lakes, 答over ヰmountain and ゐvalley.

At ゐlast she 别came to a 别cave at the ヰmouth of which, on a 答stone, 别sate an 答ゐold, 答ゐold ヰman with a 拆white 金beard.

"good ヰmorrow, fair ヰdamsel," ｐhe юsaid; "whither away so fast?"

"ю拣reverend father," ゐ拆replies she, "I go to 梆seek ヰmy 桂叼fortune."

"and what ｐhast thou for 拣dowry, fair ヰdamsel," юsaid ｐhe, "in thy bag and bottle?"

"юbread and 梆cheese and ヰ佛small-beer, father," юsays she, ヰ拆ゐsmiling. "路Will it ゐ梆please you to 葛别partake of 拆either?"

"with 佛all ヰmy ｐ葛heart," юsays ｐhe, and юwhen she ゐpulled out ｐher provisions ｐhe 别ate юthem 金ゐnearly 佛all. 仇But 仇once юagain she ヰ别made no ヰゐ别complaint, 仇but bade ｐhim 梆eat what ｐhe 梆needed, and юゐwelcome.

Now юwhen ｐhe ｐhad finished ｐhe 别gave ｐher ヰюmany thanks, and юsaid:

"for your 筐beauty, and your 拆kindness, and your 别grace, 别take this wand. There is a thick 桂thorny ｐюhedge before you which 梆ヰseems ヰimpassable. 仇But 拆strike it 拆thrice with this wand, 别saying 梆each 拆time, 'Please, ｐюhedge, ゐюlet ヰme through,'and it will 答open a pathway for you. юThen, юwhen you 仇come to a юwell, sit down on the brink of it; do not be 拣拆surprised at юanything you ヰmay see, 仇but, юwhatever you are asked to do, that do!"

So 别saying the 答ゐold ヰman юwent into the 别cave, and she юwent on ｐher way. After a 拆while she 别came to a ｐhigh, thick 桂thorny ｐюhedge; 仇but юwhen she 仇struck it three 拆ヰtimes with the wand, 别saying, "路ゐ梆Please, ｐюhedge, ゐюlet ヰme through," it 答opened a 拆wide pathway for ｐher. So she 别came to the юwell, on the brink of which she 别sate down, and no 叼sooner ｐhad she 仇done so, than a 答ゐgolden ｐюhead without юany body 别came 仇up through the 佛water, singing as it 别came:

"wash ヰme, and 答comb ヰme, ゐlay ヰme on a bank to dry 路ゐSoftly and ゐprettily to watch the {passers} -by."

"火ゐcertainly," she юsaid, ゐpulling out ｐher ゐsilver 答comb. юThen, ゐ别placing the ｐюhead on ｐher ゐlap, she began to 答comb the 答ゐgolden ｐhair. юWhen she ｐhad 答ヰcombed it, she ゐlifted the 答ゐgolden ｐюhead ゐsoftly, and ゐ别laid it on a ヰ答primrose bank to dry. No 叼sooner ｐhad she 仇done this than 仇another 答ゐgolden ｐюhead 金appeared, singing as it 别came:

"wash ヰme, and 答comb ヰme, ゐlay ヰme on a bank to dry 路ゐSoftly and ゐprettily to watch the {passers} -by."

"火ゐcertainly," юsays she, and after 答ヰcombing the 答ゐgolden ｐhair, ゐ别placed the 答ゐgolden ｐюhead ゐsoftly on the ヰ答primrose bank, 拆beside the 火first 仇one.

юThen 别came a 火third ｐюhead out of the юwell, and it юsaid the 别same thing:

"wash ヰme, and 答comb ヰme, ゐlay ヰme on a bank to dry 路ゐSoftly and ゐprettily to watch the {passers} -by."

"with 佛all ヰmy ｐ葛heart," юsays she 别ゐgraciously, and after 别taking the ｐюhead on ｐher ゐlap, and 答ヰcombing its 答ゐgolden ｐhair with ｐher ゐsilver 答comb, there were the three 答ゐgolden ｐюheads in a row on the ヰ答primrose bank. And she 别sate down to юrest ｐ火юゐherself and ゐlooked at юthem, they were so 别quaint and pretty; and as she юrested she 金ゐcheerfully 别ate and drank the ヰ梆meagre 桂portion of the brown юbread, ｐ葛hard 梆cheese, and ヰ佛small-beer which the 答ゐold ヰman ｐhad ゐюleft to ｐher; for, though she was a king's 佛daughter, she was too proud to ヰゐ别complain.

юThen the 火first ｐюhead 答spoke. "仇拣brothers, what shall we 金weird for this ヰdamsel ｐwho ｐhas 梆been so 别gracious 仇unto 仇us? I 金weird ｐher to be so 筐beautiful that she shall 葛charm юevery 仇one she ヰ梆meets."

"and I," юsaid the юsecond ｐюhead, "金weird ｐher a 娥voice that shall 梆exceed the 拆别ゐnightingale's in 梆sweetness."

"and I," юsaid the 火third ｐюhead, "金weird ｐher to be so 桂fortunate that she shall ヰmarry the 别greatest 路King that 别reigns."

"thank you with 佛all ヰmy ｐ葛heart," юsays she; "仇but 答don't you think I ｐhad юbetter put you back in the юwell before I go on? ヰюヰRemember you are 答ゐgolden, and the {passers} -by ヰ拆might 梆steal you."

To this they 梆agreed; so she put юthem back. And юwhen they ｐhad thanked ｐher for ｐher 拆kind 佛thought and юsaid good-bye, she юwent on ｐher ○火journey.

Now she ｐhad not ゐtravelled far before she 别came to a forest where the 路King of the 仇country was ｐ仇hunting with ｐhis 答ゐnobles, and as the gay ゐ别cavalcade passed down the ゐ别glade she stood back to 娥avoid юthem; 仇but the 路King 佛caught 拆sight of ｐher, and drew 仇up ｐhis ｐ桂horse, 吼ゐfairly ヰ别amazed at ｐher 筐beauty.

"fair ヰ别maid," ｐhe юsaid, "ｐwho 葛art thou, and whither {goest} thou through the forest 仇thus ゐ答alone?"

"I 别юam the 路King of 路ゐю拣Colchester's 佛daughter, and I go to 梆seek ヰmy 桂叼fortune," юsays she, and ｐher 娥voice was 梆sweeter than the 拆别ゐnightingale's.

юThen the 路King ○仇ヰjumped from ｐhis ｐ桂horse, 梆being so 仇struck by ｐher that ｐhe юゐfelt it would be ヰimpossible to ゐ拆live without ｐher, and 佛ゐfalling on ｐhis knee юbegged and 别prayed ｐher to ヰmarry ｐhim without ゐdelay.

And ｐhe юbegged and 别prayed so юwell that at ゐlast she юconsented. So, with 佛all 火courtesy, ｐhe ヰmounted ｐher on ｐhis ｐ桂horse ｐ拆behind ｐhim, and ヰcommanding the ｐ仇hunt to ゐfollow, ｐhe 火returned to ｐhis ゐpalace, where the юwedding юfestivities took ゐ别place with 佛all possible ヰpomp and ヰюヰmerriment. юThen, 桂拣ordering out the 娥royal 攫chariot, the ｐhappy pair 葛started to pay the 路King of 路ゐюColchester a 拆bridal visit: And you ヰmay ヰ○imagine the 拣拆surprise and ゐ拆delight with which, after so 桂short an absence, the 梆people of 路ゐюColchester saw their ゐ仇beloved, 筐beautiful, 拆kind, and 别gracious юprincess 火return in a 攫chariot 佛all ○юヰgemmed with 答ゐgold, as the 拆bride of the ヰ答most 拣powerful 路King in the 火ゐworld. The юゐbells rang out, ゐflags ゐflew, 仇ヰdrums 梆beat, the 梆people {huzzaed} , and 佛all was ゐgladness, 别save for the 仇ゐugly 路梆Queen and ｐher 仇ゐugly 佛daughter, ｐwho were юready to 火burst with юenvy and ヰゐmalice; for, see you, the 拆despised ヰ别maiden was now 仇above юthem 答both, and юwent before юthem at юevery 路桂Court юヰ答攫ceremonial.

So, after the visit was юended, and the 仇young 路King and ｐhis 拆bride ｐhad gone back to their 答own 仇country, there to ゐ拆live ｐゐhappily юever after, the 仇ゐugly ill-别拣natured юprincess юsaid to ｐher ヰ仇mother, the 仇ゐugly 路梆Queen:

"I 佛ゐalso will go into the 火ゐworld and 梆seek ヰmy 桂叼fortune. If that drab of a 火girl with ｐher ヰmincing 别ways got so ヰ仇much, what ヰmay I not юget?"

So ｐher ヰ仇mother 梆agreed, and 火furnished ｐher 桂forth with ゐsilken юdresses and 火furs, and 别gave ｐher as provisions sugar, ヰalmonds, and 梆ヰ梆sweetmeats of юevery 拣拆variety, 拆besides a ゐ葛large ゐflagon of 路ヰゐMalaga sack. 佛ゐюAltogether a 拆right 娥royal 拣dowry.

葛ヰArmed with 梆these she юset 桂forth, ゐ答following the 别same 答road as ｐher юstep-sister. 仇Thus she 叼soon 别came upon the 答ゐold ヰman with a 拆white 金beard, ｐwho was 梆seated on a 答stone by the ヰmouth of a 别cave.

"good ヰmorrow," юsays ｐhe. "whither away so fast?"

"what's that to you, 答ゐold ヰman?" She ゐ拆replied 叼ゐrudely.

"and what ｐhast thou for 拣dowry in bag and bottle?" ｐHe asked 拆ゐquietly.

"good things with which you shall not be 仇ゐtroubled," she 拣answered 火ゐpertly.

"ゐwilt thou not spare an 答ゐold ヰman 仇ヰsomething?" ｐHe юsaid.

Scratched and 桂torn]

юThen she ゐlaughed. "not a 拆bite, not a 仇sup, ゐюlest they should 答choke you: Though that would be ヰ佛small ヰmatter to ヰme," she ゐ拆replied, with a toss of ｐher ｐюhead.

"юthen ill ゐ仇luck go with thee," ヰ葛remarked the 答ゐold ヰman as ｐhe 答rose and юwent into the 别cave.

So she юwent on ｐher way, and after a 拆time 别came to the thick 桂thorny ｐюhedge, and 梆seeing what she 佛thought was a gap in it, she 拆tried to pass through; 仇but no 叼sooner ｐhad she got юwell into the ヰmiddle of the ｐюhedge than the 桂thorns ゐ答closed in 拣around ｐher so that she was 佛all scratched and 桂torn before she 仇won ｐher way. 仇Thus, 梆ヰstreaming with ゐ仇blood, she юwent on to the юwell, and 梆seeing 佛water, 别sate on the brink юintending to ゐюcleanse ｐ火юゐherself. 仇But ○仇just as she dipped ｐher ｐhands, 仇up 别came a 答ゐgolden ｐюhead singing as it 别came:

"wash ヰme, and 答comb ヰme, ゐlay ヰme on the bank to dry 路ゐSoftly and ゐprettily to watch the {passers} -by."

"a ゐ拆ゐlikely 桂story," юsays she. "拆I'm 答going to wash ヰ拆юゐmyself." And with that she 别gave the ｐюhead 仇such a bang with ｐher bottle that it bobbed ゐbelow the 佛water. 仇But it 别came 仇up юagain, and so did a юsecond ｐюhead, singing as it 别came:

"wash ヰme, and 答comb ヰme, ゐlay ヰme on the bank to dry 路ゐSoftly and ゐprettily to watch the {passers} -by."

"not I," scoffs she. "拆I'm 答going to wash ヰmy ｐhands and 别face and ｐhave ヰmy dinner." So she юfetches the юsecond ｐюhead a 叼cruel bang with the bottle, and 答both ｐюheads 仇ducked down in the 佛water.

仇But юwhen they 别came 仇up юagain 佛all {draggled} and dripping, the 火third ｐюhead 别came 佛ゐalso, singing as it 别came:

"wash ヰme, and 答comb ヰme, ゐlay ヰme on the bank to dry 路ゐSoftly and ゐprettily to watch the {passers} -by."

By this 拆time the 仇ゐugly юprincess ｐhad ゐюcleansed ｐ火юゐherself, and, 梆seated on the ヰ答primrose bank, ｐhad ｐher ヰmouth full of sugar and ヰalmonds.

"not I," юsays she as юwell as she could. "拆I'm not a 拣ヰwasherwoman nor a 葛barber. So 别take that for your washing and 答ヰcombing."

And with that, ｐhaving finished the 路ヰゐMalaga sack, she ゐ仇flung the юヰempty bottle at the three ｐюheads.

仇But this 拆time they didn't 仇duck. They ゐlooked at 梆each 仇other and юsaid, "路ｐHow shall we 金weird this 叼rude 火girl for ｐher bad ヰ拣manners?" юThen the 火first ｐюhead юsaid:

"I 金weird that to ｐher 仇ゐugliness shall be added ゐblotches on ｐher 别face."

And the юsecond ｐюhead юsaid:

"I 金weird that she shall юever be ｐ桂hoarse as a crow and 梆speak as if she ｐhad ｐher ヰmouth full."

юThen the 火third ｐюhead юsaid:

"and I 金weird that she shall be ゐglad to ヰmarry a ゐcobbler."

юThen the three ｐюheads sank into the юwell and were no ヰmore 梆seen, and the 仇ゐugly юprincess юwent on ｐher way. 仇But, ゐlo and ｐ答ゐbehold! юWhen she 别came to a town, the ゐchildren ran from ｐher 仇ゐugly ゐblotched 别face 梆ヰscreaming with 拆fright, and юwhen she 拆tried to юtell юthem she was the 路King of 路ゐю拣Colchester's 佛daughter, ｐher 娥voice 梆squeaked ゐ拆like a 桂corn-别crake's, was ｐ桂hoarse as a 答crow's, and 答folk could not 仇拣understand a 火word she юsaid, because she 答spoke as if ｐher ヰmouth was full!

Now in the town there ｐhappened to be a ゐcobbler ｐwho not ゐlong before ｐhad ヰюmended the 叼shoes of a poor 答ゐold ｐ火ヰhermit; and the ゐlatter, ｐhaving no ヰ仇money, ｐhad 别paid for the ○job by the gift of a 仇拣wonderful 娥ヰointment which would 拣cure ゐblotches on the 别face, and a bottle of ヰюmedicine that would banish юany ｐ桂hoarseness.

So, 梆seeing the ヰ拣miserable, 仇ゐugly юprincess in 别great юdistress, ｐhe юwent 仇up to ｐher and 别gave ｐher a few drops out of ｐhis bottle; and юthen 仇拣understanding from ｐher rich 拆attire and ゐ金clearer 梆speech that she was 梆indeed a 路King 佛daughter, ｐhe ゐcraftily юsaid that if she would 别take ｐhim for a ｐ仇husband ｐhe would 仇拣别undertake to 拣cure ｐher.

"юanything! юAnything!" Sobbed the ヰ拣miserable юprincess.

So they were ヰmarried, and the ゐcobbler 别straightway юset off with ｐhis 拆bride to visit the 路King of 路ゐюColchester. 仇But the юゐbells did not ring, the 仇ヰdrums did not 梆beat, and the 梆people, юinstead of {huzzaing} , 火burst into ゐloud 佛guffaws at the ゐcobbler in ゐюleather, and ｐhis 拆wife in ゐsilks and satins.

As for the 仇ゐugly 路梆Queen, she was so 别○enraged and 娥disappointed that she юwent ヰmad, and ｐhanged ｐ火юゐherself in wrath. 吼Whereupon the 路King, 攫ゐreally ゐ梆pleased at юgetting rid of ｐher so 叼soon, 别gave the ゐcobbler a ｐ仇hundred pounds and bade ｐhim go about ｐhis business with ｐhis 仇ゐugly 拆bride.

Which ｐhe did 拆quite юゐcontentedly, for a ｐ仇hundred pounds ヰ梆means ヰ仇much to a poor ゐcobbler. So they юwent to a ヰ答remote 葛part of the kingdom and ゐlived 仇ｐゐunhappily for ヰюmany 金years, ｐhe ゐcobbling 叼shoes, and she spinning the юthread for ｐhim.

ヰMr. 路Fox

ゐ别Lady 路ヰ吼Mary was 仇young and 路ゐ别Lady 路ヰ吼Mary was fair, and she ｐhad ヰmore ゐ仇拣lovers than she could count on the 拣fingers of 答both ｐhands.

She ゐlived with ｐher two 仇拣brothers, ｐwho were юvery proud and юvery fond of their 筐beautiful sister, and юvery anxious that she should 叼choose юwell ヰ仇amongst ｐher ヰюmany 叼拣suitors.

Now ヰ仇amongst юthem there was a 火certain 路ヰMr. Fox, ｐhandsome and 仇young and rich; and though 答nobody 拆quite knew ｐwho ｐhe was, ｐhe was so ゐgallant and so gay that юevery 仇one ゐ拆liked ｐhim. And ｐhe 叼wooed 路ゐ别Lady 路ヰ吼Mary so юwell that at ゐlast she ヰpromised to ヰmarry ｐhim. 仇But though ｐhe 佛talked ヰ仇much of the 筐beautiful ｐ答home to which ｐhe would 别take ｐher, and 拆described the castle and 佛all the 仇拣wonderful things that 火furnished it, ｐhe юnever 拣offered to show it to ｐher, 拆neither did ｐhe 拆invite 路ゐ别Lady 路ヰ吼Mary's 仇拣brothers to see it.

Now this 梆ヰseemed to ｐher юvery 别strange 梆indeed; and, 梆being a ゐlass of spirit, she ヰ别made 仇up ｐher ヰ拆mind to see the castle if she could.

So 仇one day, ○仇just before the юwedding, юwhen she knew 路ヰMr. Fox would be away 梆seeing the ゐ佛拣lawyers with ｐher 仇拣brothers, she ○仇just {kilted} 仇up ｐher 火skirts and юset out 仇答unbeknownst--for, see you, the ｐ答whole ｐｐ答ゐhousehold was busy 吼preparing for the ヰmarriage {feastings} --to see for ｐ火юゐherself what 路ヰMr. Fox 筐beautiful castle was ゐ拆like.

After ヰюmany {searchings} , and ヰ仇much ゐtravelling, she found it at ゐlast; and a 拆fine strong ゐbuilding it was, with ｐhigh 佛ゐwalls and a 梆deep ヰ答moat to it. A bit frowning and ゐ叼ヰgloomy, 仇but юwhen she 别came 仇up to the 拆wide 别gateway she saw 梆these 火words {carven} 答over the 葛arch:

_be 答ゐbold--be 答ゐbold. _

So she ゐ仇plucked 仇up 仇courage, and the 别gate 梆being 答open, юwent through it and found ｐ火юゐherself in a 拆wide, юヰempty, 答open 桂葛courtyard. At the юend of this was a ヰ佛ゐsmaller door, and 答over this was {carven} :

_be 答ゐbold, be 答ゐbold; 仇but not too 答ゐbold. _

So she юwent through it to a 拆wide, юヰempty ｐ佛hall, and 仇up the 拆wide, юヰempty 吼别staircase. Now at the top of the 吼别staircase there was a 拆wide, юヰempty ゐ拣gallery at 仇one юend of which were 拆wide 答windows with the 仇ゐ拆sunlight 梆ヰstreaming through юthem from a 筐beautiful 葛garden, and at the 仇other юend a narrow door, 答over the 葛archway of which was {carven} :

_be 答ゐbold, be 答ゐbold; 仇but not too 答ゐbold, ゐюlest that your ｐ葛heart's ゐ仇blood should 仇run 答ゐcold. _

Now 路ゐ别Lady 路ヰ吼Mary was a ゐlass of spirit, and so, of 桂course, she 火turned ｐher back on the 仇拆sunshine, and 答opened the narrow, 葛dark door. And there she was in a narrow, 葛dark passage. 仇But at the юend there was a chink of ゐ拆light. So she юwent 桂拣forward and put ｐher eye to the chink--and what do you think she saw?

Why! A 拆wide ゐ叼saloon ゐlit with ヰюmany ゐcandles, and 佛all round it, 仇some ｐhanging by their юnecks, 仇some 梆seated on 吼chairs, 仇some ゐ拆lying on the ゐfloor, were the юゐskeletons and bodies of 仇ヰ拣numbers of 筐beautiful 仇young ヰ别maidens in their юwedding-юdresses that were 佛all 别stained with ゐ仇blood.

Now 路ゐ别Lady 路ヰ吼Mary, for 佛all she was a ゐlass of spirit, and 别brave as 别brave, could not ゐlook for ゐlong on 仇such a ｐhorrid 拆sight, so she 火turned and ゐюfled. Down the 葛dark narrow passage, through the 葛dark narrow door which she did not 拣юforget to ゐ答close ｐ拆behind ｐher), and ゐalong the 拆wide ゐ拣gallery she ゐюfled ゐ拆like a ｐhare, and was ○仇just 答going down the 拆wide 吼stairs into the 拆wide ｐ佛hall юwhen, what did she see, through the window, 仇but 路ヰMr. Fox dragging a 筐beautiful 仇young ゐ别lady across the 拆wide 桂葛courtyard! There was 仇nothing for it, 路ゐ别Lady 路ヰ吼Mary 拆decided, 仇but to ｐ拆hide ｐ火юゐherself as ゐquickly and as юbest she ヰ拆might; so she ゐюfled faster down the 拆wide 吼stairs, and ｐhid ｐ火юゐherself ｐ拆behind a big 拆wine-仇butt that stood in a 桂corner of the 拆wide ｐ佛hall. She was 答ゐonly ○仇just in 拆time, for there at the 拆wide door was 路ヰMr. Fox dragging the poor 仇young ヰ别maiden ゐalong by the ｐhair; and ｐhe dragged ｐher across the 拆wide ｐ佛hall and 仇up the 拆wide 吼stairs. And юwhen she ゐ仇clutched at the 拣bannisters to stop ｐ火юゐherself, 路ヰMr. Fox 火cursed and swore юゐdreadfully; and at ゐlast ｐhe drew ｐhis 桂sword and 佛brought it down so ｐ葛hard on the poor 仇young ゐ别lady's wrist that the ｐhand, 仇cut off, ○仇ヰjumped 仇up into the air so that the 拆ヰdiamond ring on the finger ゐflashed in the 仇ゐ拆sunlight as it юfell, of 佛all ゐ别places in the 火ゐworld, into 路ゐ别Lady 路ヰ吼Mary's юvery ゐlap as she crouched ｐ拆behind the 拆wine-仇butt!

юThen she was fair 拆frightened, thinking 路ヰMr. Fox would be sure to 拆find ｐher; 仇but after ゐlooking about a ゐlittle 拆while in 别vain for, of 桂course, ｐhe 仇coveted the 拆ヰdiamond ring), ｐhe 筐continued ｐhis юdreadful task of dragging the poor, 筐beautiful 仇young ヰ别maiden 仇吼upstairs to the ｐhorrid 别ヰchamber, юintending, ゐdoubtless, to 火return юwhen ｐhe ｐhad finished ｐhis {loathly} 火work, and 梆seek for the ｐhand.

仇But by that 拆time 路ゐ别Lady 路ヰ吼Mary ｐhad ゐюfled; for no 叼sooner did she ｐhear the 佛awful, dragging 娥noise pass into the ゐ拣gallery, than she 仇upped and ran for dear ゐ拆life--through the 拆wide door with

Now the юvery юnext day, юwhen 路ヰMr. Fox and 路ゐ别Lady 路ヰ吼Mary's 仇拣brothers 火returned from the ゐ佛拣lawyers, the ヰmarriage-contract ｐhad to be 拆signed. "ｐhow 别pale you are this ヰ桂morning, dear ｐ葛heart."

юThen 路ゐ别Lady 路ヰ吼Mary ゐlooked at ｐhim 拆ゐquietly and юsaid, "路юYes, dear sir! I ｐhad a bad 拆night's юrest, for I ｐhad ｐhorrible 梆ヰdreams."

юThen 路ヰMr. Fox ヰ拆ゐsmiled and юsaid, "路梆ヰDreams go by 拣contraries, dear ｐ葛heart; 仇but юtell ヰme your 梆dream, and your 梆sweet 娥voice will 梆speed the 拆time till I can 佛call you ヰ拆mine."

_be 答ゐbold--be 答ゐbold. _"

юThen 路ヰMr. Fox 答spoke in a ｐ仇hurry. "仇but it is not so--nor it was not so."

юWent on 路ゐ别Lady 路ヰ吼Mary, still ヰ拆ゐsmiling, and ｐher 娥voice was 答ゐcold; "仇but, of 桂course, it is not so, and it was not so."

And 路ヰMr. Fox юsaid 仇nothing; ｐhe 别sate ゐ拆like a 答stone.

"仇but it is not so, of 桂course, and it was not so."

юThen 路ヰMr. Fox 答rose in ｐhis 梆seat 答ゐstonily and ゐ吼glared about ｐhim as if to 别escape, and ｐhis eye-梆teeth 答showed ゐ拆like a fox юbeset by the dogs, and ｐhe grew 别pale.

And ｐhe юsaid, 拆trying to ヰ拆smile, though ｐhis 拣whispering 娥voice could 吼ゐscarcely be ｐ火heard:

юThen 路ゐ别Lady 路ヰ吼Mary 答rose in ｐher 梆seat 佛ゐalso, and the ヰ拆smile ゐюleft ｐher 别face, and ｐher 娥voice rang as she 拆cried:

"仇but it is so, and it was so; 路ｐ金Here's ｐhand and ring I ｐhave to show."

ゐ别Ladle]

And with that she ゐpulled out the poor юdead ｐhand with the ゐ拣glittering ring from ｐher bosom and 娥pointed it 别straight at 路ヰMr. Fox.

At this 佛all the 仇ヰcompany 答rose, and 佛drawing their 桂swords 仇cut 路ヰMr. Fox to 梆pieces.

And 火served ｐhim юvery юwell 拆right.

路Dick 路Whittington and ｐhis cat

ヰMore than 拆five ｐ仇hundred 金years ago there was a ゐlittle boy 别ヰnamed 路Dick 路Whittington, and this is true. ｐHis father and ヰ仇mother 拆died юwhen ｐhe was too 仇young to 火work, and so poor ゐlittle 路Dick was юvery ゐbadly off. ｐHe was 拆quite ゐglad to юget the 吼parings of the 别答potatoes to 梆eat and a dry 仇crust of юbread now and юthen, and ヰmore than that ｐhe did not often юget, for the ゐvillage where ｐhe ゐlived was a юvery poor 仇one and the 别拣neighbours were not 别able to spare ｐhim ヰ仇much.

Now the 仇country 答folk in 答those 别days 佛thought that the 梆people of 路ゐ仇London were 佛all 拆fine ゐ别ladies and ○юゐヰюgentlemen, and that there was singing and dancing 佛all the day ゐlong, and so rich were they there that 梆even the 梆streets, they юsaid, were 别paved with 答ゐgold. 路Dick 筐used to sit by and ゐlisten 拆while 佛all 梆these 别strange 别ゐtales of the юゐwealth of 路ゐ仇London were 答ゐtold, and it ヰ别made ｐhim ゐlong to go and ゐ拆live there and ｐhave ゐюplenty to 梆eat and 拆fine ゐ答clothes to wear, юinstead of the rags and ｐ葛hard fare that юfell to ｐhis ゐlot in the 仇country.

So 仇one day юwhen a 别great waggon with 别eight ｐ桂horses stopped on its way through the ゐvillage, 路Dick ヰ别made юfriends with the waggoner and юbegged to be 别taken with ｐhim to 路ゐ仇London. The ヰman юゐfelt sorry for poor ゐlittle 路Dick юwhen ｐhe ｐ火heard that ｐhe ｐhad no father or ヰ仇mother to 别take care of ｐhim, and saw ｐhow ragged and ｐhow ゐbadly in 梆need of ｐюゐhelp ｐhe was. So ｐhe 梆agreed to 别take ｐhim, and off they юset.

ｐHow far it was and ｐhow ヰюmany 别days they took 答over the ○火journey I do not know, 仇but in due 拆time 路Dick found ｐヰюゐhimself in the 仇拣wonderful city which ｐhe ｐhad ｐ火heard so ヰ仇much of and 拣pictured to ｐヰюゐhimself so ゐgrandly. 仇But oh! ｐHow 娥disappointed ｐhe was юwhen ｐhe got there. ｐHow 火dirty it was! And the 梆people, ｐhow 仇ゐ拆unlike the gay 仇ヰcompany, with ヰ筐music and singing, that ｐhe ｐhad юヰdreamt of! ｐHe 拣wandered 仇up and down the 梆streets, 仇one after 仇another, until ｐhe was 拆拣tired out, 仇but not 仇one did ｐhe 拆find that was 别paved with 答ゐgold. 火Dirt in ゐюplenty ｐhe could see, 仇but 仇none of the 答ゐgold that ｐhe 佛thought to ｐhave put in ｐhis pockets as fast as ｐhe 答chose to pick it 仇up.

答ゐGold]

ゐLittle 路Dick ran about till ｐhe was 拆拣tired and it was 答growing 葛dark. And at ゐlast ｐhe 拣sat ｐヰюゐhimself down in a 桂corner and юfell ゐ梆asleep. юWhen ヰ桂morning 别came ｐhe was юvery 答ゐcold and ｐ仇hungry, and though ｐhe asked юevery 仇one ｐhe ヰюmet to ｐюゐhelp ｐhim, 答ゐonly 仇one or two 别gave ｐhim a ｐ别halfpenny to buy 仇some юbread. For two or three 别days ｐhe ゐlived in the 梆streets in this way, 答ゐonly ○仇just 别able to 梆keep ｐヰюゐhimself ゐ拆alive, юwhen ｐhe ヰ○managed to юget 仇some 火work to do in a {hayfield} , and that юkept ｐhim for a 桂short 拆time ゐlonger, till the ｐ别ヰ别haymaking was 答over.

After this ｐhe was as ゐbadly off as юever, and did not know where to 火turn. 仇One day in ｐhis 拣wanderings ｐhe ゐlay down to юrest in the 桂doorway of the ｐhouse of a rich ヰ火merchant ｐ叼whose 别name was 路Fitzwarren. 仇But ｐhere ｐhe was 叼soon 梆seen by the cook-ヰ别maid, ｐwho was an 仇拆unkind, bad-юヰ拣tempered ヰwoman, and she 拆cried out to ｐhim to be off. "ゐ别lazy 答rogue," she 佛ゐcalled ｐhim; and she юsaid 梆she'd юprecious quick throw 仇some 火dirty 佛dishwater 答over ｐhim, 娥ゐboiling ｐhot, if ｐhe didn't go. ｐюHowever, ○仇just юthen 路ヰMr. 路Fitzwarren ｐヰюゐhimself 别came ｐ答home to dinner, and юwhen ｐhe saw what was ｐhappening, ｐhe asked 路Dick why ｐhe was ゐ拆lying there. "筐you're 答ゐold 仇enough to be at 火work, ヰmy boy," ｐhe юsaid. "拆I'm 别afraid you ｐhave a ヰ拆mind to be ゐ别lazy."

"梆indeed, sir," юsaid 路Dick to ｐhim, "梆indeed that is not so"; and ｐhe 答ゐtold ｐhim ｐhow ｐ葛hard ｐhe ｐhad 拆tried to юget 火work to do, and ｐhow ill ｐhe was for want of 叼food. 路Dick, poor юゐfellow, was now so 梆weak that though ｐhe 拆tried to stand ｐhe ｐhad to ゐlie down юagain, for it was ヰmore than three 别days since ｐhe ｐhad ｐhad юanything to 梆eat at 佛all. The 拆kind ヰ火merchant 别gave 桂拣orders for ｐhim to be 别taken into the ｐhouse and 别gave ｐhim a good dinner, and юthen ｐhe юsaid that ｐhe was to be юkept, to do what 火work ｐhe could to ｐюゐhelp the cook.

And now 路Dick would ｐhave 梆been ｐhappy 仇enough in this good ヰゐfamily if it ｐhad not 梆been for the ill-别拣natured cook, ｐwho did ｐher юbest to ヰ别make ゐ拆life a 火burden to ｐhim. 拆Night and ヰ桂morning she was for юever 答ゐscolding ｐhim. 仇Nothing ｐhe did was good 仇enough. It was 路ゐLook 葛sharp ｐhere" and 路ｐ仇Hurry 仇up there," and there was no ゐ梆pleasing ｐher. And ヰюmany's the 梆beating ｐhe ｐhad from the 叼ヰbroomstick or the ゐ别ladle, or юwhatever юゐelse she ｐhad in ｐher ｐhand.

At ゐlast it 别came to the 金ears of 路ヰMiss 路ゐAlice, 路ヰMr. 路Fitzwarren's 佛daughter, ｐhow ゐbadly the cook was 梆treating poor 路Dick. And she 答ゐtold the cook that she would ゐquickly ゐ叼lose ｐher ゐ别place if she didn't 梆treat ｐhim ヰmore 拆ゐkindly, for 路Dick ｐhad 仇become 拆quite a 别拣favourite with the ヰゐfamily.

After that the cook's ｐ别behaviour was a ゐlittle юbetter, 仇but 路Dick still ｐhad 仇another ｐ葛hardship that ｐhe bore with ゐdifficulty. For ｐhe ゐюslept in a garret where were so ヰюmany ｐ答ゐholes in the 佛ゐwalls and the ゐfloor that юevery 拆night as ｐhe ゐlay in юbed the 叼room was 答拣仇overrun with rats and ヰ拆mice, and 仇ヰ拆ヰsometimes ｐhe could ｐ葛ゐhardly ゐ梆sleep a wink. 仇One day юwhen ｐhe ｐhad 火earned a юpenny for ゐ梆cleaning a ○юゐヰgentleman's 叼shoes, ｐhe ヰюmet a ゐlittle 火girl with a cat in ｐher 葛ヰarms, and asked юwhether she would not юsell it to ｐhim. "юyes, she would," she юsaid, though the cat was 仇such a good ヰmouser that she was sorry to 葛part with ｐher. This ○仇just 叼suited 路Dick, ｐwho юkept pussy 仇up in ｐhis garret, 梆feeding ｐher on scraps of ｐhis 答own dinner that ｐhe 别saved for ｐher юevery day. In a ゐlittle 拆while ｐhe ｐhad no ヰmore bother with the rats and ヰ拆mice. Puss 叼soon saw to that, and ｐhe ゐюslept sound юevery 拆night.

叼Soon after this 路ヰMr. 路Fitzwarren ｐhad a ship юready to 别sail; and as it was ｐhis 仇custom that 佛all ｐhis 火servants should be given a chance of good 桂叼fortune as юwell as ｐヰюゐhimself, ｐhe 佛ゐcalled юthem 佛all into the counting-ｐhouse and asked юthem what they would юsend out.

They 佛all ｐhad 仇ヰsomething that they were ゐwilling to юventure юexcept poor 路Dick, ｐwho ｐhad 拆neither ヰ仇money nor goods, and so could юsend 仇nothing. For this 梆reason ｐhe did not 仇come into the 叼room with the юrest. 仇But 路ヰMiss 路ゐAlice юguessed what was the ヰmatter, and 桂拣ordered ｐhim to be 佛ゐcalled in. She юthen юsaid, "I will ゐlay down 仇some ヰ仇money for ｐhim out of ヰmy 答own 火purse"; 仇but ｐher father 答ゐtold ｐher that would not do, for it ヰ仇must be 仇ヰsomething of ｐhis 答own.

юWhen 路Dick ｐ火heard this ｐhe юsaid, "I ｐhave 仇nothing юwhatever 仇but a cat, which I 佛bought for a юpenny 仇some 拆time ago."

"go, ヰmy boy, юfetch your cat юthen," юsaid ｐhis ヰmaster, "and ゐюlet ｐher go."

路Dick юwent 仇吼upstairs and юfetched poor puss, 仇but there were 金tears in ｐhis 拆eyes юwhen ｐhe 别gave ｐher to the captain. "for," ｐhe юsaid, "I shall now be юkept 别awake 佛all 拆night by the rats and ヰ拆mice." 佛All the 仇ヰcompany ゐlaughed at 路Dick's odd юventure, and 路ヰMiss 路ゐAlice, ｐwho юゐfelt sorry for ｐhim, 别gave ｐhim 仇some ヰ仇money to buy 仇another cat.

Now this, and 仇other ヰ葛marks of 拆kindness 答shown ｐhim by 路ヰMiss 路ゐAlice, ヰ别made the ill-юヰ拣tempered cook ○юゐjealous of poor 路Dick, and she began to 筐use ｐhim ヰmore 叼ゐcruelly than юever, and was 佛ゐ别always ヰ别making 别game of ｐhim for юsending ｐhis cat to sea. "what do you think your cat will юsell for?" 梆She'd ask. "as ヰ仇much ヰ仇money as would buy a stick to 梆beat you with?"

At ゐlast poor 路Dick could not bear this 筐usage юany ゐlonger, and ｐhe 佛thought ｐhe would 仇run away. So ｐhe ヰ别made a 仇bundle of ｐhis things--ｐhe ｐhadn't ヰюmany--and 葛started юvery 火ゐearly in the ヰ桂morning, on 路佛All-ｐゐ答hallows 路Day, the 火first of 路答юヰNovember. ｐHe 佛walked as far as 路ｐゐHolloway, and there ｐhe 拣sat down to юrest on a 答stone, which to this day, they say, is 佛ゐcalled 路Whittington 路答Stone," and began to 仇wonder to ｐヰюゐhimself which 答road ｐhe should 别take.

拆While ｐhe was thinking what ｐhe should do the 路юゐBells of 路Bow 路火Church in 路梆拆Cheapside began to 拆chime, and as they rang ｐhe fancied that they were singing 答over and 答over юagain:

"火turn юagain, 路Whittington, 路ゐ桂Lord 路ヰMayor of 路ゐ仇London."

"ゐ桂lord 路ヰMayor of 路ゐ仇London!" юSaid ｐhe to ｐヰюゐhimself. "why, to be sure, wouldn't I put 仇up with 佛ゐヰ答almost юanything now to be 路ゐ桂Lord 路ヰMayor of 路ゐ仇London, and 拆ride in a 拆fine 答coach, юwhen I grow to be a ヰman! юWell, 拆I'll go back, and think 仇nothing of the 仇cuffing and 答ゐscolding of the cross 答ゐold cook if I 别юam to be 路ゐ桂Lord 路ヰMayor of 路ゐ仇London at ゐlast."

So back ｐhe юwent, and ｐhe was ゐ仇lucky 仇enough to юget into the ｐhouse and юset about ｐhis 火work before the cook 别came down.

仇But now you ヰ仇must ｐhear what юbefell 路ヰMrs. Puss 佛all this 拆while. The ship 路筐桂Unicorn_ that she was on was a ゐlong 拆time at sea, and the cat ヰ别made ｐ火юゐherself 筐useful, as she would, ヰ仇among the 仇юゐunwelcome rats that ゐlived on 桂board too. At ゐlast the ship put into ｐ葛harbour on the 答coast of {Barbary} , where the 答ゐonly 梆people are the 路ヰ拣Moors. They ｐhad юnever before 梆seen a ship from 路ゐEngland, and ゐflocked in 仇ヰ拣numbers to see the 别ゐ拣sailors, ｐ叼whose 拣different 仇ゐcolour and foreign юdress were a 别great 仇wonder to юthem. They were 叼soon 梆eager to buy the goods with which the ship was ゐ别laden, and 拣patterns were юsent ashore for the 路King to see. ｐHe was so ヰ仇much ゐ梆pleased with юthem that ｐhe юsent for the captain to 仇come to the ゐpalace, and 拣honoured ｐhim with an 别invitation to dinner. 仇But no 叼sooner were they 梆seated, as is the 仇custom there, on the 拆fine 仇rugs and 葛carpets that 仇拣covered the ゐfloor, than 别great 仇ヰ拣numbers of rats and ヰ拆mice 别came ヰ拣scampering in, 桂ヰswarming 答over 佛all the dishes, and ｐюゐhelping ヰюゐthemselves from 佛all the good things there were to 梆eat. The captain was ヰ别amazed, and 仇拣wondered юwhether they didn't 拆find 仇such a юpest ヰ答most 仇ゐюunpleasant.

答ゐTold]

"oh юyes," юsaid they, "it was so, and the 路King would give ｐhalf ｐhis юtreasure to be 梆freed of юthem, for they not 答ゐonly 娥spoil ｐhis dinner, 仇but they 梆even attack ｐhim in ｐhis юbed at 拆night, so that a watch ｐhas to be юkept 拆while ｐhe is ゐ梆sleeping, for fear of юthem."

The captain was 答拣○娥overjoyed; ｐhe 佛thought at 仇once of poor 路Dick 路Whittington and ｐhis cat, and юsaid ｐhe ｐhad a 梆creature on 桂board ship that would 叼soon do for 佛all 梆these 火ヰvermin if she were there. Of 桂course, юwhen the 路King ｐ火heard this ｐhe was 梆eager to юpossess this 仇拣wonderful ヰanimal.

"bring it to ヰme at 仇once," ｐhe юsaid; "for the 火ヰvermin are юdreadful, and if 答ゐonly it will do what you say, I will ゐ答load your ship with 答ゐgold and ○叼ゐjewels in 别exchange for it."

The captain, ｐwho knew ｐhis business, took care not to 仇拣别underrate the ゐvalue of 路Dick's cat. ｐHe 答ゐtold 路ｐHis 路ヰ○Majesty ｐhow 梆攫inconvenient it would be to 葛part with ｐher, as юwhen she was gone the rats ヰ拆might destroy the goods in the ship; ｐюhowever, to ゐ拆oblige the 路King, ｐhe would юfetch ｐher.

"oh, ヰ别make ｐ别haste, do!" 拆Cried the 路梆Queen; "I, too, 别юam 佛all ヰ别impatience to see this dear 梆creature."

Off юwent the captain, 拆while 仇another dinner was got юready. ｐHe took 路Puss 仇under ｐhis 葛arm and got back to the ゐpalace ○仇just in 拆time to see the 葛carpet 仇拣covered with rats and ヰ拆mice 仇once юagain. юWhen 路Puss saw юthem, she didn't 别wait to be 答ゐtold, 仇but ○仇ヰjumped out of the captain's 葛ヰarms, and in no 拆time 佛ゐヰ答almost 佛all the rats and ヰ拆mice were юdead at ｐher 梆feet, 拆while the юrest of юthem ｐhad 仇ゐscuttled off to their ｐ答ゐholes in 拆fright.

The 路King was ゐ拆delighted to юget rid so 梆ゐeasily of 仇such an ゐ拣intolerable ゐ别plague, and the 路梆Queen 拆拣desired that the ヰanimal ｐwho ｐhad 仇done юthem 仇such a 火service ヰ拆might be 佛brought to ｐher. Upon which the captain 佛ゐcalled out, "路Puss, puss, puss," and she 别came 仇running to ｐhim. юThen ｐhe юpresented ｐher to the 路梆Queen, ｐwho was rather 别afraid at 火first to 仇touch a 梆creature ｐwho ｐhad ヰ别made 仇such a ｐhavoc with ｐher ゐ佛claws. ｐюHowever, юwhen the captain 佛ゐcalled ｐher, "路Pussy, pussy," and began to 答stroke ｐher, the 路梆Queen 佛ゐalso ю拣ventured to 仇touch ｐher and 拆cried, "路仇Putty, 仇putty," in ヰ别imitation of the captain, for she ｐhadn't ゐ火learned to 梆speak 路ゐEnglish. ｐHe юthen put ｐher on to the 路梆Queen ゐlap, where she 火purred and ゐ别played with 路ｐHer 路ヰ○Majesty ｐhand and was 叼soon ゐ梆asleep.

The 路King ｐhaving 梆seen what 路ヰMrs. Puss could do, and ゐ火learning that ｐher kittens would 叼soon stock the ｐ答whole 仇country, and 梆keep it free from rats, after 葛bargaining with the captain for the ｐ答whole ship's 葛cargo, юthen 别gave ｐhim юten 拆ヰtimes as ヰ仇much for the cat as 佛all the юrest ヰamounted to.

The captain юthen юsaid 吼юfarewell to the 桂court of {Barbary} , and after a fair 娥voyage 梆reached 路ゐ仇London юagain with ｐhis юprecious ゐ答load of 答ゐgold and ○叼ゐjewels 别safe and sound.

仇One ヰ桂morning 火ゐearly 路ヰMr. 路Fitzwarren ｐhad ○仇just 仇come to ｐhis counting-ｐhouse and юゐsettled ｐヰюゐhimself at the юdesk to count the cash, юwhen there 别came a knock at the door. "ｐ叼who's there?" юSaid ｐhe. "a юfriend," ゐ拆replied a 娥voice. "I 仇come with good 筐news of your ship the 路筐桂Unicorn_." The ヰ火merchant in ｐ别haste 答opened the door, and ｐwho were there 仇but the ship's captain and the ヰ别mate, 吼bearing a юchest of ○叼ゐjewels and a bill of ゐ别lading. юWhen ｐhe ｐhad ゐlooked this 答over ｐhe ゐlifted ｐhis 拆eyes and thanked ｐюheaven for юsending ｐhim 仇such a 拣prosperous 娥voyage.

The honest captain юnext 答ゐtold ｐhim 佛all about the cat, and 答showed ｐhim the rich юpresent the 路King ｐhad юsent for ｐher to poor 路Dick. ○娥Rejoicing on ｐbehalf of 路Dick as ヰ仇much as ｐhe ｐhad 仇done 答over ｐhis 答own good 桂叼fortune, ｐhe 佛ゐcalled out to ｐhis 火servants to 仇come and to bring 仇up 路Dick:

"go юfetch ｐhim, and 梆we'll юtell ｐhim of ｐhis 别fame; 路Pray 佛call ｐhim 路ヰMr. Whittington by 别name."

The 火servants, 仇some of юthem, ｐю别hesitated at this, and юsaid so 别great a юtreasure was too ヰ仇much for a ゐlad ゐ拆like 路Dick; 仇but 路ヰMr. 路Fitzwarren now 答showed ｐヰюゐhimself the good ヰman that ｐhe was and 筐refused to 拆deprive ｐhim of the ゐvalue of a single юpenny. "路God 拣forbid!" ｐHe 拆cried. "it's 佛all ｐhis 答own, and ｐhe shall ｐhave it, to a 葛farthing."

ｐHe юthen юsent for 路Dick, ｐwho at the ヰ答ヰmoment was 拣scouring pots for the cook and was ゐblack with 火dirt. ｐHe 拆tried to 筐excuse ｐヰюゐhimself from 仇ヰcoming into the 叼room in 仇such a ゐ拆plight, 仇but the ヰ火merchant ヰ别made ｐhim 仇come, and ｐhad a chair юset for ｐhim. And ｐhe юthen began to think they ヰ仇must be ヰ别making 别game of ｐhim, so ｐhe юbegged юthem not to ゐplay tricks on a poor ヰsimple boy, 仇but to ゐюlet ｐhim go 吼downstairs юagain back to ｐhis 火work in the 仇ゐ拣scullery.

"梆indeed, 路ヰMr. Whittington," юsaid the ヰ火merchant, "we are 佛all 拆quite in 火earnest with you, and I ヰ答most ｐ葛ゐheartily ○娥rejoice at the 筐news that 梆these ○юゐヰюgentlemen ｐhave 佛brought. For the captain ｐhas 答ゐsold your cat to the 路King of {Barbary} , and brings you in 火return for ｐher ヰmore riches than I юpossess in the ｐ答whole 火ゐworld; and ヰmay you ゐlong ○enjoy юthem!"

ヰMr. 路Fitzwarren юthen 答ゐtold the ヰюmen to 答open the 别great юtreasure they ｐhad 佛brought with юthem, 别saying, "路There is 仇nothing ヰmore now for 路ヰMr. Whittington to do 仇but to put it in 仇some ゐ别place of 别safety."

Poor 路Dick ｐ葛ゐhardly knew ｐhow to ｐ别behave ｐヰюゐhimself for ○joy. ｐHe юbegged ｐhis ヰmaster to 别take what 葛part of it ｐhe ゐ梆pleased, since ｐhe 答owed it 佛all to ｐhis 拆kindness. "no, no," 拣answered 路ヰMr. 路Fitzwarren, "this 佛all ゐbelongs to you; and I ｐhave no doubt that you will 筐use it юwell."

路Dick юnext юbegged ｐhis ヰmistress, and юthen 路ヰMiss 路ゐAlice, to юaccept a 葛part of ｐhis good 桂叼fortune, 仇but they would not, and at the 别same 拆time 答ゐtold ｐhim what 别great ○joy they юゐfelt at ｐhis 别great юsuccess. 仇But ｐhe was far too 拆kind-ｐ葛hearted to 梆keep it 佛all to ｐヰюゐhimself; so ｐhe ヰ别made a юpresent to the captain, the ヰ别mate, and the юrest of 路ヰMr. 路Fitzwarren's 火servants; and 梆even to ｐhis 答ゐold юヰenemy, the cross cook.

After this 路ヰMr. 路Fitzwarren 拆advised ｐhim to юsend for a 别ゐtailor and юget ｐヰюゐhimself юdressed ゐ拆like a ○юゐヰgentleman, and 答ゐtold ｐhim ｐhe was юゐwelcome to ゐ拆live in ｐhis ｐhouse till ｐhe could 拆provide ｐヰюゐhimself with a юbetter.

юWhen 路Whittington 别face was washed, ｐhis ｐhair 火ゐcurled, and ｐhe was юdressed in a ヰ葛smart 叼suit of ゐ答clothes, ｐhe was ○仇just as ｐhandsome and 拆fine a 仇young ヰman as юany ｐwho visited at 路ヰMr. 路Fitzwarren's, and so 佛thought fair 路ゐAlice 路Fitzwarren, ｐwho ｐhad 仇once 梆been so 拆kind to ｐhim and ゐlooked upon ｐhim with pity. And now she юゐfelt ｐhe was 拆quite fit to be ｐher 梆ｐ葛sweetheart, and 仇none the ゐюless, no doubt, because 路Whittington was 佛ゐ别always thinking what ｐhe could do to ゐ梆please ｐher, and ヰ别making ｐher the prettiest юpresents that could be.

ヰMr. 路Fitzwarren 叼soon saw which way the 拆wind ゐblew, and ere ゐlong 答proposed to ○娥join юthem in ヰmarriage, and to this they 答both юゐreadily 梆agreed. A day for the юwedding was 叼soon fixed; and they were юattended to 火church by the 路ゐ桂Lord 路ヰMayor, the 桂court of 佛ゐ拣ヰюaldermen, the юsheriffs, and a 别great 仇ヰnumber of the richest ヰ火merchants in 路ゐ仇London, ｐ叼whom they 拣拣afterwards 梆treated with a ヰmagnificent 梆feast.

ｐ拣History юゐtells 仇us that 路ヰMr. Whittington and ｐhis ゐ别lady ゐlived in 别great ゐюsplendour, and were юvery ｐhappy. They ｐhad ю拣several ゐchildren. ｐHe was 路юSheriff, and 拆thrice 路ゐ桂Lord 路ヰMayor of 路ゐ仇London, and 梆received the honour of 拆ｐknighthood from 路ｐюHenry 路V.

After the 路King юconquest of 路France, 路Sir 路拣Richard 路Whittington ю拣别entertained ｐhim and the 路梆Queen at dinner at the 路ヰMansion 路ｐHouse in so 仇ヰsumptuous a ヰmanner that the 路King юsaid, "路юNever ｐhad 路Prince 仇such a 仇○юsubject!" To which 路Sir 路拣Richard ゐ拆replied, "路юNever ｐhad 仇○юsubject 仇such a 路Prince."

The 答ゐold ヰwoman and ｐher pig

An 答ゐold ヰwoman was 梆sweeping ｐher ｐhouse, and she found a ゐlittle crooked sixpence. "what," юsaid she, "shall I do with this ゐlittle sixpence? I will go to ヰ葛market, and buy a ゐlittle pig."

So she 佛bought a ゐlittle pig; 仇but as she was 仇ヰcoming ｐ答home, she 别came to a 拆stile, and the piggy would not go 答over the 拆stile.

She юwent a ゐlittle 火further, and she ヰюmet a dog. So she юsaid to ｐhim, "路Dog! Dog! 拆Bite pig; piggy 答won't go 答over the 拆stile; and I shan't юget ｐ答home till ヰ拆midnight." 仇But the dog wouldn't.

She юwent a ゐlittle 火further, and she ヰюmet a stick. So she юsaid, "路Stick! Stick! 梆Beat dog; dog 答won't 拆bite pig; piggy 答won't юget 答over the 拆stile; and I shan't юget ｐ答home till ヰ拆midnight." 仇But the stick wouldn't.

She юwent a ゐlittle 火further, and she ヰюmet a 拆fire. So she юsaid, "路拆Fire! 拆Fire! 火Burn stick; stick 答won't 梆beat dog; dog 答won't 拆bite pig; pig 答won't юget 答over the 拆stile; and I shan't юget ｐ答home till ヰ拆midnight." 仇But the 拆fire wouldn't.

She юwent a ゐlittle 火further, and she ヰюmet 仇some 佛water. So she юsaid, "路佛Water! 佛Water! юQuench 拆fire; 拆fire 答won't 火burn stick; stick 答won't 梆beat dog; dog 答won't 拆bite pig; pig 答won't юget 答over the 拆stile; and I shan't юget ｐ答home till ヰ拆midnight." 仇But the 佛water wouldn't.

She юwent a ゐlittle 火further, and she ヰюmet an ox. So she юsaid, "路Ox! Ox! Drink 佛water; 佛water 答won't юquench 拆fire; 拆fire 答won't 火burn stick; stick 答won't 梆beat dog; dog 答won't 拆bite pig; pig 答won't юget 答over the 拆stile; and I shan't юget ｐ答home till ヰ拆midnight." 仇But the ox wouldn't.

She юwent a ゐlittle 火further, and she ヰюmet a butcher. So she юsaid, "路Butcher! Butcher! Kill ox; ox 答won't drink 佛water; 佛water 答won't юquench 拆fire; 拆fire 答won't 火burn stick; stick 答won't 梆beat dog; dog 答won't 拆bite pig; pig 答won't юget 答over the 拆stile; and I shan't юget ｐ答home till ヰ拆midnight." 仇But the butcher wouldn't.

She юwent a ゐlittle 火further, and she ヰюmet a 答rope. So she юsaid, "路答Rope! 答Rope! ｐHang butcher; butcher 答won't kill ox; ox 答won't drink 佛water; 佛water 答won't юquench 拆fire; 拆fire 答won't 火burn stick; stick 答won't 梆beat dog; dog 答won't 拆bite pig; pig 答won't юget 答over the 拆stile; and I shan't юget ｐ答home till ヰ拆midnight." 仇But the 答rope wouldn't.

She юwent a ゐlittle 火further, and she ヰюmet a rat. So she юsaid, "路Rat! Rat! Gnaw 答rope; 答rope 答won't ｐhang butcher; butcher 答won't kill ox; ox 答won't drink 佛water; 佛water 答won't юquench 拆fire; 拆fire 答won't 火burn stick; stick 答won't 梆beat dog; dog 答won't 拆bite pig; pig 答won't юget 答over the 拆stile; and I shan't юget ｐ答home till ヰ拆midnight." 仇But the rat wouldn't.

She юwent a ゐlittle 火further, and she ヰюmet a cat. So she юsaid, "路Cat! Cat! Kill rat; rat 答won't gnaw 答rope; 答rope 答won't ｐhang butcher; butcher 答won't kill ox; ox 答won't drink 佛water; 佛water 答won't юquench 拆fire; 拆fire 答won't 火burn stick; stick 答won't 梆beat dog; dog 答won't 拆bite pig; pig 答won't юget 答over the 拆stile; and I shan't юget ｐ答home till ヰ拆midnight." 仇But the cat юsaid to ｐher, "路If you will go to yonder cow, and юfetch ヰme a 佛saucer of ヰゐmilk, I will kill the rat." So away юwent the 答ゐold ヰwoman to the cow.

仇But the cow юsaid to ｐher, "路If you will go to yonder ｐ别haystack, and юfetch ヰme a ｐhandful of ｐhay, 拆I'll give you the ヰゐmilk." So away юwent the 答ゐold ヰwoman to the ｐ别haystack; and she 佛brought the ｐhay to the cow.

As 叼soon as the cow ｐhad 梆eaten the ｐhay, she 别gave the 答ゐold ヰwoman the ヰゐmilk; and away she юwent with it in a 佛saucer to the cat.

As 叼soon as the cat ｐhad ゐlapped 仇up the ヰゐmilk, the cat began to kill the rat; the rat began to gnaw the 答rope; the 答rope began to ｐhang the butcher; the butcher began to kill the ox; the ox began to drink the 佛water; the 佛water began to юquench the 拆fire; the 拆fire began to 火burn the stick; the stick began to 梆beat the dog; the dog began to 拆bite the pig; the ゐlittle pig 梆ゐsquealed and ○仇ヰjumped 答over the 拆stile; and so the 答ゐold ヰwoman got ｐ答home before ヰ拆midnight.

The wee bannock

仇Once upon a 拆time there was an 答ゐold ヰman and ｐhis 答ゐold 拆wife ｐwho ゐlived in a wee cottage 拆beside a wee {burnie} . They ｐhad two cows, 拆five ｐюhens, and a cock, a cat and two kittens. Now the 答ゐold ヰman ゐlooked after the cows, the cock ゐlooked after the ｐюhens, the cat ゐlooked after a ヰmouse in the 仇拣cupboard, and the two kittens ゐlooked after the 答ゐold 拆wife's spindle as it 火ゐtwirled and 仇ゐtussled about on the {hearthstone} . 仇But though the 答ゐold 拆wife should ｐhave ゐlooked after the kittens, the ヰmore she юsaid, " {Sho} ! {Sho} ! Go away, kitty!" The ヰmore they ゐlooked after the spindle!

So, 仇one day, юwhen she was 拆quite 拆拣tired out with 别saying, " {Sho} ! {Sho} !" The 答ゐold 拆wife юゐfelt ｐ仇hungry and 佛thought she could 别take a wee 拆bite of 仇ヰsomething. So she 仇up and 别baked two wee 答ヰ梆oatmeal bannocks and юset юthem to 答toast before the 拆fire. Now ○仇just as they were 答toasting away, ヰюゐsmelling so юfresh and 别tasty, in 别came the 答ゐold ヰman, and 梆seeing юthem ゐlook so crisp and 拆nice, 别takes 仇up 仇one of юthem and snaps a 梆piece out of it. On this the 仇other bannock 佛thought it ｐhigh 拆time to be off, so 仇up it ○仇ヰjumps and away it 仇ゐtrundles as fast as юever it could. And away ran the 答ゐold 拆wife after it as fast as she could 仇run, with ｐher spindle in 仇one ｐhand and ｐher distaff in the 仇other. 仇But the wee bannock 仇ゐtrundled faster than she could 仇run, so it was 叼soon out of 拆sight, and the 答ゐold 拆wife was ゐ拆○obliged to go back and 仇tussle with the kittens юagain.

The wee bannock ヰ梆拆meanwhile 仇ゐtrundled 别ゐgaily down the ｐhill till it 别came to a big thatched ｐhouse, and it ran 答ゐゐboldly in at the door and 别sate юゐitself down by the 拆拣拆fireside 拆quite 仇ヰ拣ゐcomfortably. Now there were three 别ゐ拣tailors in the 叼room 火working away on a big юbench, and 梆being 别ゐ拣tailors they were, of 桂course, юゐdreadfully 别afraid, and ○仇ヰjumped 仇up to ｐ拆hide ｐ拆behind the 拆goodwife ｐwho was 葛carding wool by the 拆fire.

" {Hout} -tout!" She 拆cried. "what are ye a-金feared of? 'Tis佛naught 仇but a wee bit bannock. ○仇Just grip ｐ答ゐhold 答o's it, and 拆I'll give ye a 仇sup 答o's ヰゐmilk to drink with it."

So 仇up she юgets with the {carders} in ｐher ｐhands, and the 别ゐtailor ｐhad ｐhis 拆拣iron 叼goose, and the юapprentices, 仇one with the big 拣scissors and the 仇other with the 拆拣ironing-桂board, and they 佛all ヰ别made for the wee bannock; 仇but it was too ゐюclever for юthem, and ○dodged about the 拆拣拆fireside until the юapprentice, thinking to snap it with the big 拣scissors, юfell into the ｐhot ashes and got ゐbadly 火burnt. юThen the 别ゐtailor cast the 叼goose at it, and the 仇other юapprentice the 拆拣ironing-桂board; 仇but it wouldn't do. The wee bannock got out at the 桂doorway, where the 拆goodwife ゐ仇flung the {carders} at it; 仇but it ○dodged юthem and 仇ゐtrundled away 别ゐgaily till it 别came to a ヰ佛small ｐhouse by the 答road-拆side. So in it ran 答ゐbold as 答ゐbold and 别sate юゐitself down by the ｐ葛hearth where the 拆wife was 拆winding a ゐclue of 葛yarn for ｐher ｐ仇husband, the 梆weaver, ｐwho was ゐclick-ゐclacking away at ｐhis ゐ叼loom.

" {Tibby} !" 答Quoth the 梆weaver. "юwhatever that?"

"佛naught 仇but a wee bannock," 答quoth she.

"юwell, 仇come and юゐwelcome," юsays ｐhe, "for the porridge was thin the ヰ桂morn; so grip it, ヰwoman! Grip it!"

"aye," юsays she, and 梆reaches out ｐher ｐhand to it. 仇But the wee bannock ○仇just ○dodged.

"ヰman!" юSays she, "yon's a ゐюclever wee {bannockie} ! Catch it, ヰman! Catch it if you can."

仇But the wee bannock ○仇just ○dodged. "cast the ゐclue at it, ヰwoman!" Shouted the 梆weaver.

仇But the wee bannock was out at the door, 仇ゐtrundling away 答over the ｐhill ゐ拆like a new 葛tarred 梆sheep or a ヰmad cow!

And it 仇ゐtrundled away till it 别came to a ｐ火cowherd's ｐhouse where the 拆goodwife was 火churning ｐher 仇butter.

"仇come in by," 拆cried the 拆goodwife юwhen she saw the wee bannock 佛all crisp and юfresh and 别tasty; "拆I've ゐюplenty 梆cream to 梆eat with you."

仇But at this the wee bannock began ○dodging about, and it ○dodged so ゐcraftily that the 拆goodwife 答拣юoverset the 火churn in 拆trying to grip it, and before she юset it 别straight юagain the wee bannock was off, 仇ゐtrundling away down the ｐhill till it 别came to a ヰmill-ｐhouse where the ヰゐmiller was sifting ヰ梆meal. So in it ran and 别sate down by the trough.

"ｐho, ｐho!" юSays the ヰゐmiller. "it's a 拆sign 答o's ゐюplenty юwhen the ゐ拆likes of you 仇run about the 仇country-拆side with 仇none to ゐlook after you. 仇But 仇come in by. I ゐ拆like bannock and 梆cheese for 仇supper, so 拆I'll give ye a 拆night's 桂拣quarters." And with that ｐhe tapped ｐhis fat 仇ヰstomach.

At this the wee bannock 火turned and ran; it wasn't 答going to 仇trust юゐitself with the ヰゐmiller and ｐhis 梆cheese; and the ヰゐmiller, ｐhaving 仇nothing 仇but the ヰ梆meal to ゐfling after it, ○仇just stood and 吼stared; so the wee bannock 仇ゐtrundled 拆ゐquietly ゐalong the ゐюlevel till it 别came to the ヰsmithy where the ヰsmith was юゐwelding ｐ桂horse-别ゐnails.

"ｐゐhullo!" юSays ｐhe, "筐you're a юwell-答toasted bannock. 筐You'll do 拆fine with a ゐglass of 别ale! So 仇come in by and 拆I'll give you a ゐ○lodging 拆inside." And with that ｐhe ゐlaughed, and tapped ｐhis fat 仇ヰstomach.

仇But the wee bannock 佛thought the 别ale was as bad as the 梆cheese, so it 仇up and away, with the ヰsmith after it. And юwhen ｐhe couldn't 仇come 仇up with it, ｐhe ○仇just cast ｐhis ｐヰhammer at it. 仇But the ｐヰhammer ヰmissed and the wee bannock was out of 拆sight in a crack, and 仇ゐtrundled and 仇ゐtrundled till it 别came to a 葛farm-ｐhouse where the ヰgoodman and ｐhis 拆wife were 梆beating out ゐflax and 答ヰcombing it. So it ran in to the 拆拣拆fireside and began to 答toast юゐitself юagain.

"路○Janet," юsays the ヰgoodman, "yon is a юwell-答toasted wee bannock. 拆I'll ｐhave the ｐhalf of it."

"and 拆I'll 别take {t'other} ｐhalf," юsays the 拆goodwife, and 梆reached out a ｐhand to grip it. 仇But the wee bannock ゐ别played {dodgings} юagain.

"ヰmy {certy} ," юsays the 拆wife, "仇but 筐you're {spirity} !" And with that she cast the ゐflax 答comb at it. 仇But it was too ゐюclever for ｐher, so out it 仇ゐtrundled through the door and away was it down the 答road, till it 别came to 仇another ｐhouse where the 拆goodwife was 火stirring the 佛ゐscalding 叼soup and the ヰgoodman was ゐplaiting a 桂thorn ゐcollar for the calf. So it 仇ゐtrundled in, and 别sate down by the 拆fire.

"ｐho, 路○Jock!" 答Quoth the 拆goodwife, "筐you're 佛ゐ别always 拆crying on a юwell-答toasted bannock. ｐ金Here's 仇one! 仇Come and 梆eat it!"

юThen the wee bannock 拆tried {dodgings} юagain, and the 拆goodwife 拆cried on the ヰgoodman to ｐюゐhelp ｐher grip it.

"aye, ヰ仇mother!" юSays ｐhe, "仇but 吼where's it gone?"

"答over there!" 拆Cries she. "quick! 仇Run to {t'other} 拆side 答o's yon chair." And the chair 仇юupset, and down 别came the ヰgoodman ヰ仇among the 桂thorns. And the 拆goodwife she ゐ仇flung the 叼soup 叼spoon at it, and the 佛ゐscalding 叼soup юfell on the ヰgoodman and 佛ゐscalded ｐhim, so the wee bannock ran out in a crack and was away to the юnext ｐhouse, where the 答folk were ○仇just sitting down to their 仇supper and the 拆goodwife was 别scraping the pot.

"ゐlook!" 拆Cries she, "ｐ金here's a wee юwell-答toasted bannock for ｐhim as catches it!"

"ゐюlet's 仇shut the door 火first," юsays the 佛cautious ヰgoodman, "afore we try to юget a grip on it."

Now юwhen the wee bannock ｐ火heard this it ○仇○judged it was 拆time to be off; so away it 仇ゐtrundled and they after it ｐюゐhelter-юゐskelter. 仇But though they threw their 叼spoons at it, and the ヰgoodman cast ｐhis юbest ｐhat, the wee bannock was too ゐюclever for юthem, and was out of 拆sight in a crack.

юThen away it 仇ゐtrundled till it 别came to a ｐhouse where the 答folk were ○仇just away to their юbeds. The 拆goodwife she was 别raking out the 拆fire, and the ヰgoodman ｐhad 别taken off ｐhis 梆breeches.

"what's yon?" юSays ｐhe, for it was nigh 葛dark.

"it will ○仇just be a wee bannock," юsays she.

"I could 梆eat the ｐhalf of it," юsays ｐhe.

"and I could 梆eat {t'other} ," 答quoth she.

юThen they 拆tried to grip it; 仇but the wee bannock 拆tried ○dodging. And the ヰgoodman and the 拆goodwife 仇ヰゐtumbled юagainst 梆each 仇other in the 葛dark and grew angry.

"cast your 梆breeches at it, ヰman!" 拆Cries the 拆goodwife at ゐlast. "what's the 筐use of standing 吼staring ゐ拆like a 仇stuck pig?"

So the ヰgoodman cast ｐhis 梆breeches at it and 佛thought ｐhe ｐhad ヰ仇拣smothered it sure 仇enough; 仇but 仇ヰｐsomehow it ゐwriggled out, and away it was, the ヰgoodman after it without ｐhis 梆breeches. You юnever saw 仇such a 别race--a 攫real ゐ梆clean 别chase 答over the 葛park, and through the {whins} , and round by the ヰbramble patch. 仇But there the ヰgoodman ゐlost 拆sight of it and ｐhad to go back 佛all scratched and 拆拣tired and 拣shivering.

The wee bannock, ｐюhowever, 仇ゐtrundled on till it was too 葛dark 梆even for a wee bannock to see.

юThen it 别came to a fox's ｐ答hole in the 拆side of a big {whinbush} and 仇ゐtrundled in to юspend the 拆night there; 仇but the fox ｐhad ｐhad no ヰ梆meat for three ｐ答whole 别days, so ｐhe ○仇just юsaid, "路筐You're юゐwelcome, юfriend! I wish there were two of you!"

And there were two! For ｐhe snapped the wee bannock into ｐhalves with 仇one 拆bite. So that was an юend of it_!

ｐHow 路○Jack юwent out to 梆seek ｐhis 桂叼fortune

仇Once on a 拆time there was a boy 别ヰnamed 路○Jack, and 仇one ヰ桂morning ｐhe 葛started to go and 梆seek ｐhis 桂叼fortune.

ｐHe ｐhadn't gone юvery far before ｐhe ヰюmet a cat.

"where are you 答going, 路○Jack?" юSaid the cat.

"I 别юam 答going to 梆seek ヰmy 桂叼fortune."

"路ヰMay I go with you?"

"юyes," юsaid 路○Jack, "the ヰmore the ヰюmerrier."

So on they юwent, 路○Jack and the cat. ○ゐJiggelty-○答ゐjolt, ○ゐjiggelty-○答ゐjolt, ○ゐjiggelty-○答ゐjolt!

They юwent a ゐlittle 葛farther and they ヰюmet a dog.

"where are you 答going, 路○Jack?" юSaid the dog.

"I 别юam 答going to 梆seek ヰmy 桂叼fortune."

"路ヰMay I go with you?"

"юyes," юsaid 路○Jack, "the ヰmore the ヰюmerrier."

So on they юwent, 路○Jack, the cat, and the dog! ○ゐJiggelty-○答ゐjolt, ○ゐjiggelty-○答ゐjolt, ○ゐjiggelty-○答ゐjolt!

They юwent a ゐlittle 葛farther and they ヰюmet a 答goat.

"where are you 答going, 路○Jack?" юSaid the 答goat.

"I 别юam 答going to 梆seek ヰmy 桂叼fortune."

"路ヰMay I go with you?"

"юyes," юsaid 路○Jack, "the ヰmore the ヰюmerrier."

So on they юwent, 路○Jack, the cat, the dog, and the 答goat. ○ゐJiggelty-○答ゐjolt, ○ゐjiggelty-○答ゐjolt, ○ゐjiggelty-○答ゐjolt!

They юwent a ゐlittle 葛farther and they ヰюmet a bull.

And they юwent on ○ゐjiggelty-○答ゐjolting till it was about 葛dark, and it was 拆time to think of 仇some ゐ别place where they could юspend the 拆night. юThen ｐhe юwent back and 答ゐtold ｐhis ヰcompanions to 别wait till ｐhe 别gave the 火word, and юthen to ヰ别make 佛all the 娥noise they ゐpossibly could in their 答own fashion. So юwhen they were 佛all юready 路○Jack 别gave the 火word, and the cat ヰ筐mewed, and the dog 葛barked, and the 答goat ゐ梆bleated, and the bull юゐ答bellowed, and the 叼rooster 答crowed, and 佛all юtogether they ヰ别made 仇such a 拣terrific ｐ仇仇hubbub that the 拣robbers ○仇ヰjumped 仇up in a 拆fright and ran away, ゐ梆leaving their 答ゐgold on the 别table. So, after a good ゐlaugh, 路○Jack and ｐhis ヰcompanions юwent in and took юpossession of the ｐhouse and the 答ゐgold.

Now 路○Jack was a 拆wise boy, and ｐhe knew that the 拣robbers would 仇come back in the юdead of the 拆night to юget their 答ゐgold, and so юwhen it 别came 拆time to go to юbed ｐhe put the cat in the rocking-chair, and ｐhe put the dog 仇under the 别table, and ｐhe put the 答goat 仇吼upstairs, and ｐhe put the bull in the юゐcellar, and bade the 叼rooster ゐfly 仇up on to the 叼roof.

юThen ｐhe юwent to юbed.

Now sure 仇enough, in the юdead of the 拆night, the 拣robbers юsent 仇one ヰman back to the ｐhouse to ゐlook after their ヰ仇money. 仇But before ゐlong ｐhe 别came back in a 别great 拆fright and 答ゐtold юthem a 金fearsome 别tale!

"I юwent back to the ｐhouse," юsaid ｐhe, "and юwent in and 拆tried to sit down in the rocking-chair, and there was an 答ゐold ヰwoman knitting there, and she--oh ヰmy! --仇stuck ｐher knitting-梆ゐneedles into ヰme."

(_that was the cat, you know. _)

"юthen I юwent to the 别table to ゐlook after the ヰ仇money, 仇but there was a 叼ヰ别shoemaker 仇under the 别table, and ヰmy! ｐHow ｐhe 仇stuck ｐhis 佛awl into ヰme."

(_that was the dog, you know. _)

(_that was the 答goat, you know. _)

"юthen I 葛started to go down to the юゐcellar, 仇but--oh dear ヰme! --there was a ヰman down there chopping wood, and ｐhe knocked ヰme 仇up and ｐhe knocked ヰme down ○仇just юterrible with ｐhis axe."

(_that was the bull, you know. _)

"仇but I shouldn't ｐhave ヰ拆minded 佛all that if it ｐhadn't 梆been for an 佛awful ゐlittle юゐfellow on the top of the ｐhouse by the kitchen ヰchimney, ｐwho юkept a-ｐゐ拣hollering and ｐゐ拣hollering, 'Cookｐhim in a stew! Cook ｐhim in a stew! Cook ｐhim in a stew! '"

(_and that, of 桂course, was the cock-a-叼doodle- {doo} . _)

юThen the 拣robbers 梆agreed that they would rather ゐ叼lose their 答ゐgold than ヰ梆meet with 仇such a 别fate; so they ヰ别made off, and 路○Jack юnext ヰ桂morning юwent 别ゐgaily ｐ答home with ｐhis 叼booty.
